Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk!”
Reviews.Author: jcnd
Reviews.Content: I felt I needed to post a review of this property to show that the reviews posted by my husband and travel companion were true and accurate. The management of Lighthouse Court responded to both of their posts with inaccurate information stating they were “fabricating” information and “dishonest” about what took place, basically saying they lied. That is just about the furthest from the truth as the pictures we took will tell the true story. I would like to have the trip advisor community decide which side of the story is the true side of the story based on the photographs. I’m not going to respond to each of their claims individually, but I think once you see what we saw and had to experience you will understand. The responses to both posts by management show their complete lack of customer service and that they can lie so easily.

Reviews.Title: “Key West convenient”
Reviews.Author: grubb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with two friends spent five great days in Key West in mid February 2012. The weather was fantastic and Key West is full of fun things to do. It took a while to sort out where we wanted to stay as none of us had been to Key West before. After weeks of searching on line it became apparent that there are no cheap places to stay in Key West and our focus came down to location. We wanted to be close to the action on Duval Street but not close enough to be disturbed by it. We also wanted to be centrally located to the beach areas and restuarants. Our other criteria was that we wanted to experience some Key West charm with the older style buildings and neighborhoods. After a long search we came up with the Lighthouse Court. The building is full of Key West charm and sits directly across the street from the Hemingway home, which by the way, is well worth the price of admission, An historic lighthouse is visible from the property. Lighthouse Court is one block from Duval St. but sits in a quiet, scenic neighborhood. Many great restuarants and bars are in easy walking distance. If you walk a short distance north from the Lighthouse Court you can see Mallory Square and the cruise ship docks. If you walk a shorter distance south you will come to the Southernmost Point in the US and a great little cafe on the beach that serves a great, inexpensive breakfast. Our room at Lighthouse Court, a suite, was very roomy and clean. We had a King Bed, a large bathroom, and a separate sitting room. A small deck out front overlooked a nice pool area that featured a small pool bar and an area that served a continental breakfast every morning. The only complaint about the breakfast was that there was no fruit, only cereal, bagels, toast, etc. The only negative about our stay, and it's not a huge one, is that there was a rooster roaming the property. This seems to be a regular occurance at many Key West properties. This particular rooster was very noisy and set up camp directly under our bedroom window. He could be heard at all hours of the very early morning and I would suspect that is why there was a basket of earplugs in our room. Having said that, our stay at the Lighthouse Court was very enjoyable. The property was beautiful, well kept, and the location couldn't have been more perfect for what we wanted to do in Key West. I would recommend it to anyone looking for old Key West charm instead of a large chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right off Duval”
Reviews.Author: vpsales
Reviews.Content: Cute little hotel that is a group of old buildings that have been remodeled along with the surrounding property. Very clean and relaxing stay, hotel's location was ideal. Park your car and forget about it, your in Key West! The ladies at front desk were very helpful and gave us a lot of free drink coupons( KW is 30-50% more expensive than normal). Go to 915 Bistro and El Siboney restaurants, absolutely to die for cant miss spots. Only knock I had for LightHouse was the beds in the room, it seems they saved the old doors during the remodel and recycled them into beds. We will stay here again, but will check the bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alison109
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Lighthouse Court in a king room for 4 nights. It was high season, so of course it was overpriced. The room was fine, a bit old, but clean. I was glad we had the air conditioner because it drowned out the roosters in the early morning hours. Comfortable bed, nice linens. Breakfast could definitely use some improving - where is all the fresh Florida fruit?? The pool is decent. In all, we enjoyed our stay at Lighthouse Court, but we were barely in the room. The location is great for sightseeing, eating, and bar hopping.

Reviews.Title: “Gave it one star since zero wasn't an option!!”
Reviews.Author: Shaun B
Reviews.Content: This was by far the most disgusting place I have ever been! Needless to say we booked four nights and stayed one, had we been able to leave right away we would have. But it was President's Day Weekend and Key West was packed and the very unfriendly staff knew it. The first room we were given had torn furniture cushions, moldy dirty bathroom tiles, smelled god awful and there was debris (hair, crumbs, paint chips etc.) running along the floor boards. When we approached the front desk and explained our dissatisfaction over the room and more importantly its cleanliness, they seemed shocked and stated â€œwe are one of the historic inns of Key West and these are the things that make us historicâ€�. It was almost as if they were used to dropping this line on people. It became the standard line across the board for the 16 or so hours we stayed there. After a debating with the extremely unfriendly front desk clerk she agreed to go and look at the room with us. Upon entering she didnâ€™t seem to see any problems again telling us it was the whole â€œhistoricâ€� thing and because of the humidity in Key West you canâ€™t always keep things from getting moldy. Upon returning to the front desk we told her we would like another room and we were not sure we wanted to stay at all. She began whispering with the other clerk and got up and went behind a closed door to make a phone call presumably to the manager. She was able to find another room, but told my wife that we needed to make a decision if we were going to stay or not. Otherwise if someone else came to check in, she was going to give the room away. Since we had nothing else lined up we said we would take it and then began the mad dash to find an alternate location. The second room was a little better than the first, but not by much. There were wrappers on top of the shower wall that appeared to have been there for a while. Stickers, debris and even used toilet paper between the toilet and the walls. The room was in major need of cosmetic work as well, cracked walls, chipping paint and dirty carpet. We turned the ceiling fan off because it was a bit breezy over the bed and the caked on dirt and dust was unexplainable. In the morning when we were checking out, I asked the same very unfriendly clerk if the manager was working. She was and I explained my dissatisfaction with her regarding all of the above issues. I explained that for the $325 I paid for one night was downright criminal. I stressed to her that I wanted to walk through the room with her to see if she felt it was worth $325. Once inside the room she saw what I was talking about and again the â€œhistoricâ€� line came out. I told her I was grateful she had refunded the money for the other three nights, but didnâ€™t feel it was right to pay full price for the state that room was in. She ended up giving me a credit of $100, but I felt I still got ripped off. I would say The Lighthouse Court is similar if not lesser quality than a Motel 6 or Red Roof Inn. We were able to find a beautiful little cottage at Simonton Court and it was actually less money than what the Lighthouse Court was charging. I thought I had this terrible experience in the rearview mirror until my wife realized she left her phone charger in the room. I called the desk two days after we had left and they told me they had it. Luckily when I arrived the really unfriendly lady wasnâ€™t working, however I was greeted by an equally unfriendly clerk. They had the charger in a bag, with our reservation slip stapled to it. How hard would it have been to call and tell us we forgot it? They knew we were staying in Key West for another three nights after we left. There is just a complete and total lack of any customer service and common sense at this place. This is my first time posting on Trip Advisor, mostly because I like to use it to find out about places before traveling. The Lighthouse Court was just so bad that I felt I needed to let fellow travelers know what this place is like. The pictures you see on the hotelâ€™s website of really clean rooms with hard wood floors represent one or two rooms at the property. If I could have given it zero stars, I would

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Chickens”
Reviews.Author: RobW9999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lighthouse Court for 5 nights and overall the stay was pretty good. The hotel itself is pretty unique with several different types of rooms. We got a package deal on expedia with flight down to Key West and went with the Lighthouse Court since it looked to be within decent walking distance to most of the stuff we planned to see.If you plan to hang out in the Mallory Square area a lot, I'd reccomend getting a closer hotel unless you plan on driving or bringing/renting a bicycle. It's not a hard walk to do but in the summer you'll probably show up soaking in sweat if you go in the mid-afternoon. The Room: The room itself could have been better. The toilet had "issues" the first morning...the staff showed up and handed us a small plunger. We explained that it wasn't clogged so they sent someone up to fix it. We also noticed a trail of ants that went from the bedroom area to the kitchen so we didn't keep any food in there. Looking back, those issues make the room sound horrible but it was actually pretty good otherwise however if I read about those kind of things I'd probably be deterred The rest of the hotel: The location was pretty good We were right across the street from the Hemmingway house and next door to the lighthouse. It was handy being relatively close to those places when we went to them but most of the time we would go down to the Mallory square area and that is a little bit of a walk. Some of the side streets are dark and questionable on the way back late at night. The continental breakfast was pretty consistent, it had your basic juice, yogurt and bagels/muffins. No meat. We kind of liked the chickens bumming from us every day (the same chicken too), they were really friendly. (Key West seems to have tons of Chickens all over the place). We didn't really bother with the bar they had in the hotel, really small and in Key West there is no shortage of places to have a drink and short walk away. Overall it's a good place to stay if you can get a really cheap price for the hotel. If we head to Key West again we'll more than likely stay somewhere else since we'll be skipping: the southernmost point, hemmingway house and the lighthouse.

Reviews.Title: “could be improved”
Reviews.Author: drs1041
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. location is great - near hemingway house, duval, southernmost point, etc. we stayed in F1, which has a king sized bed. the room was roughly equivalent to a balcony room on a ship - which is small. it had no desk, one chair, a very small refrigerator, no closet or space to hang clothes and several small drawers for clothes. the bathroom while roomy was the most spartan i've been in. no shelves for toiletries. you had the top of the toilet, the top of a pedestal sink and a windowsill. how much would it cost to install some nice shelves in this bathroom to store toiletries? For the price, this room was more than doulbe what i would expect to pay. i could have spent the same amount of money for a cruise,and it would include all meals, entertainment,etc. So overall, the value was not to my expectations. Breakfast was totally ordinary - store bought breads, apples, 3 varieties of cereal, milk, coffee, juice. it was adequate, but nothing special for the price of the room. parking was abysmal. the property has 9 spaces for probably 25+rooms. it's first come first served each time you move, so no guarantees. and you have to give your keys to the office so they can move you if needed. Overall, we were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “my stay at the KEYS”
Reviews.Author: diane s
Reviews.Content: The Inn was beautiful in front, I enjoyed just walking back and forth and looking over to the Hemmingway house! I was not impressed with my room though. It was clean, but I felt very uncomfortable, it could have been decorated to feel more cozy, the bed was nasty and squeeked, the air conditioner was right up against the bed and kept us up all night. The shower was so small you could not move too well. The pool area was very pretty and the breakfast was nice, loved the orangejuice! Out of all the rooms I stayed in down in the Keys, this room was the worst and cost the most.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, elegant room, decent breakfast, parking included”
Reviews.Author: rita2seahorse
Reviews.Content: This was a great springboard for our short stay in Key West. We loved our suite, a bedroom and living room with foldout bed. There is a little bar in the hotel and the ambience was authentic to Key West. It's right across the street from the Hemingway House, which was a very entertaining tour, and there were many restaurants just up the street, plus other attractions which we enjoyed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: scmiketravels
Reviews.Content: I wish I planned more nights at this hotel. Very nice staff. Great location. Modern room. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are smelly and noisy”
Reviews.Author: ferjan
Reviews.Content: When you arrive in your room to find earplugs on the cupboard this is generally not a good omen, unfortunately this turned out to be true: we stayed in a room D2 close to the reception and there is wood panneling on the floor in front of the room so you wake up every time someone walks by... The room also smelled very damp and the AC was so loud you had to turn it off at night. Staff was very helpfull in finding us a parking spot and they didn't even charge us which saves them from a Terrible rating.

Reviews.Title: “Want a good night's sleep, don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: bctaa5
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels we have ever stayed in. I am writing this review early in the morning because I have been up for hours. Between the uncomfortable bed, the continuous squeal of the rooster directly outside our room and the rolling of service carts, it has been very difficult to sleep. It is so bad, they give you ear plugs with your room. The staff is not friendly. When you arrive, if you are not one of the lucky 5 people, including staff, to get a parking space in their lot, you have to park in a pay by the hour lot about two blocks away. If you are one of the lucky ones, you need to surrender your keys to the front desk and go back there every time you want to use your car. Good thing almost everything is within walking distance. That was the one positive about this hotel. We have been here for a couple of days and the shower turns cold half way through every time. I usually do not write on Trip Advisor but use it when making our travel plans. I just don't want others to have to experience what we did. Key West is beautiful and worth the trip, just don't stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Are You Kidding Me!”
Reviews.Author: Honey33462
Reviews.Content: I checked in Friday night at about 8:00 and wasted about an hour trying to switch rooms. Of course, there were none available so we stayed in this smelly, horrible room for the night! This room was located in the back and close to the street. The next day, they said they had a room available, however, they didn't know when it would be ready. I didn't want to spend my vacation time hanging around the hotel for a new room. The good news is they called my husband when the room was ready. The other room was cozy, however, very small. There isn't a place in the bathroom to put your toiletry, but the closet was big and there was a functioning safe. We live in Florida and travel frequently to Key West so for the money we paid, I was very disappointed. On a positive note, we where traveling with other couples who paid the same price as us, but had beautiful rooms. We should have never paid the same price for our room! There should be a scaling system for the room types at this place. They are definitely not all the same. This place is located right across from Hemingway's House on Whitehead St. so it's location is closer to the Southern Most Point.

Reviews.Title: “pricey for size of room”
Reviews.Author: angelladycoleedam
Reviews.Content: I choose this property on the internet and was very surprised by the size of the room for $180 per night!! We had a standard room. The service was great, the staff was very friendly, but we were so very crowded for the just the two of us. And there was no counter of any type in the bathroom for curling iron or anything. The air conditioner was loud which made it hard to sleep. Our first air conditioner was not working correctly and maintenance changed it our immediately. Parking is so hard to find in this area that we just walked everywhere. Next time, I would make a reservation at one of the chain hotels that has parking and larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, nice clean room..”
Reviews.Author: travelman1979_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year's with a few friends and we had an excellent time. Yes, it was VERY expensive, but that's what you're going to pay for that time of the year. Actually it was much cheaper then most of the other 3-4 star hotels. We arrived around noon and our room was already ready. The front desk people were very helpful and friendly as well. The location is one block from Duval St and only blocks away from all of the action. The only "negative" if you want to call that, are the ROOSTERS. The Inn provides you with earplugs and I'm glad they did. There are roosters roaming the grounds, and they start yelling at 2am! We didnt expeirence it every night though. Other than that, I would definitley return to this hotel and recommend it to other family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Jane B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Key West at this hotel for New Year's Eve weekend and was most disappointed ... cost too high, service and facilities poor!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MsLaurie
Reviews.Content: OK, let's get the negatives out of the way: my room was tiny, the hot water was virtually non existent, and the continental breakfast was 7-11 quality. In short, this is not a luxury hotel. I'd even say it's a little pricey for the quality. BUT it depends on why you travel to Key West. The location, literally next door to the lighthouse and right across the street from the Hemingway House, is terrific. I felt very safe no matter how early I rose or how late I came in, and that's important to me. The hardwood floors are immaculate. The pool area is quaint. The staff is friendly and helpful. The earplugs in the room? Those are for the roosters, not for the noise from the other patrons. So while this isn't my first choice in Key West, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Key Lime mojitos for breakfast? Yes, please!”
Reviews.Author: Schbaby
Reviews.Content: Quiet abode tucked away. Directly across the street from the Hemingway House. Best of all, you can enjoy key lime pie and a key line mojito for breakfast. Great pool area and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay if your in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: hotrodsbydewey
Reviews.Content: It gets no better than this place. Fantastic staff and service, and very heplfull with anything. The girl at the front I think her name was Mel? Blonde with dreads, super sweet and knows Key West locations like the back of her hand. The pool is clean, the rooms are always clean and cozy! Directly accross the street from the Hemingway house, and walking distance from Duvall St. Also, Fort Zachery is a bike ride away. This is the ONLY place I stay when in Key West. Very afordable

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Cyndy12
Reviews.Content: We go to Key West each year around Nov-Dec., and we like to try different B&B's. This year we tried Lighthouse Court. Great location right across from the Hemingway House. Great layout of the hotel - pool area is really nice, with a snack bar right there. I loved how all the rooms were grouped around the courtyard area. Staff was also very nice and helpful with recommendations and getting me a bike rental. Only negatives: Wi-fi is only available at the pool area, not in the rooms. Also, our room was VERY small - there were only my husband and me but we barely had room to move around once we had our stuff in the room. I would definitely stay again, but I would recommend that you get one of the Deluxe King rooms, not the standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on which bungalow you stay in. Mine was nice”
Reviews.Author: vacationdealqueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three friends. The four of us shared two rooms which connected and were in the same little cottage/bungalow building. One of the rooms was classified as a suite so there was a living room too which was good to have. Two of my friends had stayed here before and said their accommadtions were better this time. Many of the other rooms in the hotal had french doors and I could tell that our accommadtions did seem to be nicer compared to other standard rooms which had old tube televisions and white walls compared to our bright key west blue walls. I think springing for an upgraded room would definitely be worth it. The suite wasn't too much more if I remember. Skimmed the other reviews and I really think your experience will depend on what room/bungalow you get. Our two rooms were in their own little cottage/bungalow so quiet. I was very impressed with our bathrooms: very modern and clean for an older establishment. Not impressed at all with the mattresses. I personally like a very firm mattress but ouch these beds were terrible. Wish they would spring for toppers or some sort of padding. Otherwise this was a pretty good deal for us, considering the cost of surrounding hotels. The location is good here. We could easily walk or bike everywhere, free breakfast. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking to stay under 300 a night. I wish I could edit a review I made a while ago. For this trip we ended up coming a night early to Key West and had to stay at the Days Inn, because we were coming in so late and everything else was booked or uber expensive. The Days Inn was sooo gross. I would never stay at the Days Inn at Key West if I were you. Horrors. Gross bathroom, gross bed. seriously gross. Stayed there for a spring bring a while ago and it wasn't as bad... at least I thought at the time I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: gwynEngland
Reviews.Content: Good location, room basic, bed hard n uncomfortable but asked for pillow topped or softer mattress and staff very helpful. Quite a noisy area, and could hear people in a joining rooms talking n tv,s. Prob would not pay a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD location, TOO expensive, TERRIBLE parking”
Reviews.Author: nikoledawn
Reviews.Content: We just checked out yesterday from the Lighthouse Court Hotel after a 3 night stay in the "Hemingway Suite". There are both goods and bads about this hotel; here's the low-down... Good: 1) Location - Lighthouse Court is located just one block off Duval Street, so you are close to the action, but far enough it isn't loud all night. It is right across from the Hemingway Home, and a very short walk from the southernmost point marker. 2) Amenities - There is a small pool, very nice pool courtyard, small bar/cafe, and continental breakfast. We had a washer and dryer in our suite, but I don't think all rooms have that available. 3) Hemingway Suite - This is a really nice suite, but isn't worth $299/night after you read the "bads" below. There is a private wrap-around porch and beautiful open ceilings with excellent woodwork on the inside. There is a full kitchen, nice shower heat controller, washer and dryer, and upstairs loft with the bedroom. The overall appearance is excellent, but again not worth the money when all things are considered. Bads: 1) Parking - There is VERY limited parking onsite. I think that for 300 bucks a night they should have a designated spot for the Hemingway Suite to park a vehicle ("best room in the house"). We were lucky enough to find a spot to park both times we moved the car. However, while we were waiting (and waiting, and waiting) for a spot to open up, I went in and asked the lady at the front desk where we should park. She told me to go two blocks up and pay $15 per day in the public lot. I think that is assinine when we were paying $300/night for a room. More importantly, she was NOT nice about it. When you do park, you leave your keys at the front desk (hours 7am-10pm), you leave your keys with the front desk so that they can move your car if someone else needs to get out because they are parked behind each other. 2) Noise - You cannot hear the sounds of Duval Street from this location. However, the walls are paper thin. The Key West roosters started up at 3:15 each morning and it sounded like they were next to the bed. Thankfully we brought EAR PLUGS - they are a MUST if you stay here! Even with ear plugs in, we were woken by the sounds of our neighbors having a good time, if you know what I mean. The awning outside was not secured well and squeaked very loudly every time the wind blew. 3) Staff - I expect excellent staff and service when paying this kind of money. I received neither. The red-haired lady at the front desk was extremely unfriendly and made me cringe ever time we had to drop off our keys. etc. The breakfast was not put out of time on Friday which caused us to not be able to eat until 1pm that day because we were headed on an excursion and couldn't wait around. The lady that was supposed to be putting it out was certainly not in a hurry either. 4) Price - There are a lot of very nice places to stay in Key West without having to spend this kind of money. I won't make that mistake again. 5) Maintenance - The drain was clogged in our shower the first two nights and the remote for the fans was broken so we could not turn them off. The refrigerator rocked (a lot) when opening and closing the door, etc.... Overall, we had an excellent trip to Key West, but this room was not a part of our positive experience. Without a doubt, I will stay somewhere else the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably priced, average otherwise”
Reviews.Author: 99cyclone
Reviews.Content: Although the room was clean, there were hundreds, yes hundreds of horse flies in the room. Thankfully, they left us alone and stayed up on the ceiling. Still quite gross though. The room was small, but adequate, as we didn't spend much time there. Great location near Duval and Hemingway house. WiFi worked well and was nice to have. Not a bad experience, but could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “a weekend in Key West”
Reviews.Author: sandijh
Reviews.Content: A weekend in Key West can be a great experience and having the right place to stay can make or break it. The Lighthouse Court was the right place. It is located one block off of Duval and center in town. We had a King room and it was comfortable and roomy. The bathroom was large, the water hot and the shower, although high on the wall, decent. The breakfast could have used some imagination but was edible and free. The roaming chickens that are all over Key West are also at the breakfast, they do add to the ambiance of the keys but they really need to get rid of the black one that pecks at your feet. The pool was a little too cool for my likes but there were people who got in it. The pool area is nice and has plenty of room, the only mark against this place is the lack of parking. They have 9 spaces in the rear alley and about 9 spaces available our front, but these are public and the Hemingway house is across the street. Once you get a parking spot you don't dare move, but that's the good thing about the location, everything is walking distance/

Reviews.Title: “interesting couple of days”
Reviews.Author: koalasoup
Reviews.Content: Like the rest of Key West, the Lighthouse Court is not cheap but it is comfortable and clean, the staff are helpful and friendly, and the location, only one block from Duval Street made it a good choice. We were there for the first part of Fantasy Fest and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting but housekeeping needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Darwynne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect location and set up for the family wedding we were all there for (using over half the rooms). The aesthetic and character of the hotel was really nice, and there were some nice extra touches like a hammock and that hacky sack toss game. We all mostly hung out around the pool for five days and enjoyed our stay. They were accommodating by putting the families with young children in the rooms that were not immediately around the pool. p.s. We all thought the earplugs were for the roosters on-site! The entire place looks a little worn--and they are obviously in the middle of improvements as the entire week (not weekends) they were renovating a building as a new room and scraping, filling and painting the exterior. It was a bit noisy for us who spent most of our time around the pool. The rooms should be next at getting a facelift (the top of our sink was coming detached from the pedestal base, one or two bathroom tiles were loose, carpets are old), but otherwise rooms are fine, nothing high end. I will first say we thought the housekeeping staff was very sweet and engaging with our young son. However, our larger party had a number of disconcerting issues in their rooms. In short: two instances of inappropriate hair in the bed upon check-in (I will always turn the sheets back to check after this experience!); a moldy smell in one room; and a mouse in another. The first two issues were remedied by giving a new room, but still disconcerting. Our carpet could have used a real good steam cleaning (in addition to the fact that it didn't look vacuumed when we arrived). I had to spot clean some yogurt off the carpet during our stay and the towels I used were black after. The only excuse I can think of is that since so many of us were checking in around the same time, they struggled to get all the rooms ready; I would hope this wouldn't be the case all the time. Finally, the front desk staff was hit or miss, but mostly just luke warm. While they were accommodating and responsive, I would expect a bit more friendliness for a hotel like this. When I asked if I could have housekeeping come at a different time one day (since they came every day during my son's nap) so we could get a full cleaning, it was as if I'd asked them to change the rotation of the earth.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stop”
Reviews.Author: nickmBedford
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, very good location, nice staff. The only downside was the noisy air-conditioning for which they supply ear plugs! No tea/coffee making facilities either.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel with lots of Key West charm!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for couples looking for the simple Key West charm. Located in the historic area of Key West it's quiet but only a very short walk to the hustle of Duval Street. The rooms were small so it's not an ideal hotel for a family but for couples its perfect. Although the rooms and bathrooms are small, it is very cozy. The room seemed updated with newer bathroom fixtures, linnens, and a flat screen tv. The hotel rooms were very clean as well as the outside area. We didn't use the maid service during the week but everyday when we returned to our room we had fresh towels in a bag hanging on the door. The pool/bar was exactly what I thought Key West should be like. If you don't mind the occasional key west chicken (and babies!) it's the perfect relaxing atmosphere. We will definitley stay at the Lighthouse Court again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BretEt
Reviews.Content: Scenic hotel in good central location to shopping and beaches. The pool was nice rooms clean helpful staff. The free breakfast was lacking in choices but other than that it was a good stay was my second time there and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Old and small and perfect”
Reviews.Author: private65
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before deciding to stay at this hotel. Most of the complaints were that it was old and the rooms were small. If a person wants to stay at a Hilton, or similar, with all the perks that go with that price, then go stay there. This hotel is not that, nor do they claim to be. Yes, the hotel is old and the room I had was "small", but it was perfect for what I wanted, a CLEAN place to sleep so I could be rested and ready to play the next day. The hotel is old, but I found that part of the charm. The gardens were absolutely beautiful. The breakfast every morning was the perfect start to my day. My only complaint was not the fault of the hotel. One evening there was a wedding across the street at the Hemingway House. The very inconsiderate DJ played the music so loudly that after 10 pm I could still clearly hear the words to the songs being played, with my door and windows closed and my iPod playing. As I said though, this is not the hotel's fault. One morning I saw a gentleman leaving after checking out and I heard him tell the desk clerk, "See you next year." I will return and stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MrsScope
Reviews.Content: great property with beautiful grounds. the rooms were small but clean and comfortable and nicely decorated. the property has many places to sit and relax or hang out by the pool. if you get there early enough you can get one of the few FREE parking spots in the back of the hotel. other then the ever present roosters the rooms were very quiet (we had 2 rooms in the back corner of the property) and the complimentary ear plugs were not needed. the hotel is close enough to walk to everything but off the main drag so you can get away if you want. when we visit key west with out our dog we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit!”
Reviews.Author: lvskns
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at Lighthouse Court and we were very pleased with our visit. We stayed for 3 nights. The rooms could use a bit of upgrading (mostly the carpet, was pretty old) and the bed was a bit soft for our liking, but the room was clean and spacious enough for the time actually spent in it. They do offer on site parking, but it's on a first come, first serve basis. We lucked out 2 out of the 3 nights. The pool area is very nice and roomy. Having the cafe/bar area is a plus. Scott, the bartender, is awesome! We enjoyed sitting down and having a few drinks at the bar with him before heading to Duval. There are coupons out there and we found one that got us two free rum drinks for staying 2 nights and in addition 2 free admission tickets for staying the third night. We hadn't done the lighthouse yet so we took advantage of that. The proximity to Duval is nice. We didn't have any noise to speak of at night so we slept well! We will definitely return here as they do offer repeat discounts if you call to book your reservation. Thanks for a nice visit!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and comfortable in Key West”
Reviews.Author: kstaunton
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful vaca in KW. We stayed here at the Lighthouse Court Hotel and thought it was very nice. Lush, intimate grounds and lovely pool with a bar/cafe. Very convenient to grab a bite/drink and sit by the pool. More towards the quiet end, which we didn't mind. Little walk to all the action, but there's plenty to see on the way! Our room was small, but very clean and cool-on the second floor, perfect for a 3 night stay. I would definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and a cozy atmosphere. Ask them to have some bicycles delivered for you and you'll have happy feet!”
Reviews.Author: GalleryBean
Reviews.Content: Request and pay for a king size room if you are staying more than one night. Our room had a super comfy bed, nice bedding and a huge shower. There are lots of tables with umbrellas around the courtyard where guests can access their wi-fi and drink a frosty beverage from the bar. Bar closes around dark.

Reviews.Title: “Descent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelguy808
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice for us while visiting Key West. It is in a perfect location for walking to virtually anything on the key, no need for a rental car at this hotel. The rooms were clean and cold which are top priority in my opinion. Pool area is small and cozy, great place to cool off during mid day in between snorkeling/diving or other activities. The continental breakfast bar is stocked with an adequate amount of food to get you started in the mornings (muffins, juice, fruit, yogurt). The staff was friendly. I believe that this hotel is a great bargain considering the location (one street off of Duval) vs. price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: geekboi8
Reviews.Content: We initially chose Lighthouse Court because it was cheaper than others, but it was better than I expected. The room was a bit on the small side (standard room), however we weren't in there that much so it didn't really matter. Also, our room was near the ice dispenser, which can be very loud especially at night when trying to sleep. They have a nice pool, though a little warm and salty, with a bar next to it. Nice breakfast in the mornings, though I had hoped for more fresh fruit (they served bagels, muffins, coffee, juice, cereal, yogurt.) It's definitely in a great location, right next to the historic lighthouse, across the street from the Hemingway House, a block or two from Duval and a few blocks from the Southernmost Point and South Beach. The people at the front desk were pleasant and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, cute place close to Key West action”
Reviews.Author: bernienovembre
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Key West. We stayed in a standard room. The room was small, but it wasn't our intention to spend much time in it. There are much bigger rooms for those planning to stay in more. The breakfast was ok. It was a nice setting out by the pool, and the chickens around made it even nicer. The pool is a bit small, but great for cooling off in. The little cafe next to the pool is nice. There are snacks, and many different drinks available. The exterior setup of the place is very cute. There is a hammock and swinging rocker around to relax in. This place is only 1 block from Duval which is convenient. The rate for the location is especially good. I enjoyed my stay here, and I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again when I'm in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gail J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lighthouse Court from August 11 - 15. We took a suite and we were very satisfied with this room. It was very large, with the bedroom being separate from the living area. It had a bar sink, microwave, coffeepot and adequate refrigerator. The bathroom had two sinks, and the shower was enormous! There was a tv in the living area, but not in the bedroom, which was odd. There was certainly enough room to put a small one in the bedroom, and I think management should consider doing so. The pool area was very nice, with the pool itself being heated. I like a warm pool, but it was a bit too warm. A continental breakfast was served by the pool from 8:30-10:30. Coffee and juice were available at 8:00. Bagels, muffins, and some cereal were available. Lighthouse Court is located directly across from Hemingway House, which is a must see. Take the tour, which is included in the admission price. We were going to purchase the tickets, but Lighthouse Court staff gave us the tickets for free! What a nice surprise. They have a cafe on sight at the pool area, and gave us tickets for free key lime pie and a rum cocktail drink. We had a great stay at this place, and would definitely stay here again. After seeing the smaller rooms that my friends stayed in, I recommend the suite if you prefer to relax and feel like you are home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: JessicaC2011
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Lighthouse Court and can't wait to stay there again. The hotel is across the street from the Hemingway House and one block from Duval. The accommodations are comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. You will have a great view of the Key West Lighthouse from the pool. We plan on returning to Key West in the future and will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Tropical Hotel with Charm. We will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: jwarren02
Reviews.Content: The charming hotel is in a setting of lush tropical foilage across the street from the Hemmingway House. The old Lighthouse and museum are next door. This hotel is one block off of Duval St. in a quiet part of Bahama Village. It is convenient to Old Town Key West by foot, bike or Car. Most of the area is residential. The pool is in the center of the courtyard and a small bar opens onto the comfortable patio area. The majority of the rooms are downstairs. It is a cluster of buildings connected by walkways and patio areas. The staff was very courteous and helpful throughout our stay.The nice maintenance person named, Angel, went the extra mile to solve the problem with our TV within an hour. Our room A-1 was somewhat small, and did not have a closet or space to hang our clothes. This was a minor inconveninience. The bed was a bit hard for our liking and perhaps management will consider that it is time to upgrade the mattress. The bed linens were very good quality. The bath was fine, no tub but a nice sized shower. The ceilings are high so it made the size of the room seem larger. There is the added touch of a ceiling fan that made the room nice and cool. There are 2 windows in the bedroom and 1 in the bath with plantation blinds. This particular room is right next to the parking area however it is very quiet. It did rain hard one afternoon and there is no canopy to shelter you from the rain at your door. Unfortunately the room did have a musty odor. In Key West the humidity was extrememly high during our stay and could attribute to the musty smell. The room was clean and well maintained. Breakfast is included and served each morning until 10:30 and consists of juice, coffee and tea. Breads, cereals, yogurt and a fruit are also offered. Parking is very limited!! The staff suggested we park and either walk or use taxis, which we did. That was great advice! We booked our stay to include a sunset cruise which was a great adventure. We WOULD stay here again! I would consider this hotel a great place for singles and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Beach side”
Reviews.Author: jillzabo
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Lighthouse in July during my annual vacation to Ft Myers. The room we were given was in the old section, it was dated and kind of "icky". We upgraded to a newer room ($30 more) seemed cleaner and more comfortable. The best part of this hotel is the Tiki Bar. They serve breakfast which was great and very reasonably priced. Walking distance to the beach and several bars. They could do a much better job in the cleaning/updating department. I would stay again simlply because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything but in shady location”
Reviews.Author: angelaarango79
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the rooms are in good conditions and its literally 1 block away from Duval St. which is where the night life and most of the restaurants are. Parking was an issue but we found a parking spot 1 block away and we did not move it during the duration of our trip. we were able to walk everywhere. you have to make sure you dont park on a residential parking spot. The hotel is in a bit of a shady location but i am not sure how you can escape - thats just Key West -- that unless you stay at a fancy resort by the waterfront. (the westin looked like it would be amazing) But we didnt have that much money. we stayed at a suite and it had a nice little living room. very comfortable. AC worked very good. the breakfast is good and its by the pool. the only real downside was that we saw a roach. it was harmless but it was there. we also saw a lot of roosters and chickens roaming around. but these are EVERYWHERE in key west!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - small rooms but nice!!”
Reviews.Author: ThePearl14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on a retirement vacation in south Florida and stayed one night in Key West at the Lighthouse Court. The nice advantages of this hotel was the location to Duval street and downtown Key West. You can walk or catch a pedal cab ( we did ) and be right downtown in minutes. We found the rooms to be quite small but for a one night stay it was fine. The bed was great - comfy and the shower was a new reno - very nice. The breakfast at the pool in the morning was fine - not great but it had the basics. We found the office staff to be excellent. We had to make a call to Miami and they let us use the office phone - no charge!! The setting is very Key West - overall a nice place to stay and visit. We would stay again in the future Earl & Jan Surrey, BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: kimbrley
Reviews.Content: Great location-centrally located! Very clean and quiet. This was exactly what we needed after a stressful year.

Reviews.Title: “BE ADVISED......PARKING IS A NIGHTMARE!”
Reviews.Author: rhadd123
Reviews.Content: FIrst I want to say this: I am not someone who goes out of my way to write negative reviews but the hell we went through after not being told the whole truth by the desk staff with the parking issue, I felt its important to let other people know what they'll have to go through if they stay here. I also want to say Bonnie is the positive aspect of this establishment and apologized for the parking nightmare we delt with. So here we go: After reading several of the often positive reviews of this hotel, I decided to make a call to the Lighthouse. After verifying that there is plenty of parking and vacancy by the guest clerk on the phone, we packed our bags and headed to KW. Well, after the 4hr drive and finally ready to get checked in at 3pm, I was informed by the somewhat arrogant, cocky British desk clerk that they only have 5 parking spaces and they were taken until tomorrow. He told us that there was free parking in front of the hotel and more a couple of blocks down. So.... finally after driving around for over 25 minutes we finally found parking about 2 blocks away. WARNING! The hotel is in a residential area and across from the Hemmingway house so parking sucks big time. If you park in a space for reserved for residential, you will get a ticket or towed. The hotel itself was nice. Clean room, small pool deck and bar(open til 8PM),The continental breakfast is good but its hard to mess up coffee, oj, bagels, cereal and muffins. If you have plenty of patience and dont mind parking several blocks away(unless you do get lucky and get available parking in front of the hotel(I counted 6 spaces) or the 5 reserved hotel spaces then you'll probably have a great time. Just remember if you find a parking space, dont lose it! Good luck!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tatts10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 9th and 10th July 2011, and would gladly have stayed longer! All the staff were really helpful and friendly. The location was wonderful, although parking was a bit of a problem. (Being opposite Ernest Hemmingway's house!) But Bonnie on the front desk infoirmed us as soon as a space became available. All in all a truely wonderful Colonial style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jrkenn2
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was a standard guest room, with queen bed, TV, dresser, night stands and chair. The bathroom was on the small side with a tight stand-up shower and small vanity. The breakfast in the morning had a variety of offerings to choose from.The grounds were well manicured and the pool was refreshing in the hot afternoon sun. Close to everything, we were able to walk to all the nightlife, restaurants, and attractions. We were lucky to find parking on the street in front of the hotel, however, could see potential problems if you're not as lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: DZJaxFl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend 7/11/11-7/15/11 in a Standard room, #A1. It was small, but in very good shape. There was a queen bed with a nightstand on either side, dresser and wicker chair were the only furniture. As far as amenities, not a whole lot. A small flat screen tv was mounted on the wall, no refrigerator or coffee maker. There was free wi-fi that worked well. The bathroom was good size, with a shower, no tub, pedestal sink, modern toilet, wall mounted hair drier. A wall mounted A/C unit kept the room nice and cold. It was a little noisy, but it was a white noise that drowned out any outside sounds that could disturb you (other than the rooster that crows in the morning). Housekeeping provided earplugs that we didn't use. I don't require a whole lot from a hotel room other than being clean and comfortable because I don't spend much time in it. This place fit that bill. The complementary continental breakfast was good. I really didn't use the pool, but there always seemed to be someone in it or laying around the pool area. The staff was always courteous. Location is excellent, directly across from the Hemingway house and a block off Duval st. We took our bicycles, which I highly recommend. It makes getting around much easier. There were several racks at the front of the property. The only real drawback is the lack of parking. I managed to get a parking spot on the street in front of the hotel the first day and didn't move the car the rest of the time since we had our bikes. Overall I enjoyed this place and felt it met my needs quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax. We didn't want to go home!”
Reviews.Author: gracetraveler5
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is in a great location in Old Town, with excellent service and amenities. We enjoyed the pool deck, cont breakfast every morning, various spots on the property for relaxing and the beautiful, tropical landscaping. Many attractions and restaurants are within walking distance as well as bike rental places. Our standard room was small, but a perfect home away from home for us. The housekeeping service was great and I felt very comfortable. It had a large bathroom and high ceilings and ceiling fans. No fridge, but plenty of room for our coolers and endless supply of ice down the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: livlovlaf8
Reviews.Content: I found Lighthouse Court on the internet and based my choice of accomodations by what I read there. I was not disappointed. First, the Inn's location is just right for someone like me - I walked everywhere! The room size was great and there was a small refrigerator for keeping cold drinks. My room was located in the pool area and it was perfect! I came out each morning for coffee and breakfast. There is also a cafÃ© in that same area that serves salads, sandwiches and drinks...perfect is again the word that comes to mind! Those with whom I spoke when making reservations, the night manager, Zuzana and all others involved when checking in were pleasant and helpful! Scott and Peter at the cafÃ©, Frankie and the housekeeping staff are most friendly and kind! I love Key West and highly recommend staying at Lighthouse Court.

Reviews.Title: “It was a very nice, clean, and relaxing place ... great location!”
Reviews.Author: SEKinney
Reviews.Content: This is an affordable, pretty historic hotel with lush gardens and very clean grounds and rooms to stay at in Key West. It's located closer to the southern end of the island across from the Ernest Hemingway House on block off Duval. So it's close to everything and still far enough away to be quiet and relaxing. I recommend calling about your room location. We were in the first room past the office, so it was kind of public. We still liked it though because the place was quiet and it really wasn't a big deal. I would like to stay somewhere more private next time. We had a King Deluxe, which was a really good size room. I think some of the Queens were really small. My only complaint about our room is that the bathroom was weird with a SUPER teeny shower stall and one small sink ... yet there was room for a huge vanity in there. Except for that it was a nice room and the bed was comfortable. They have their own cafe and bar right next to the pool with decent prices (drinks are a little high, but hey ... you don't have to go anywhere AND KW is already expensive). The pool looks at the Lighthouse ... so it's really a great little place. The staff are very helpful with taxis, bike rentals, and whatever items you may need. I definitely recommend it as one of the many great options on the island ...

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: big4buck
Reviews.Content: Good deal and price for Key West.Walking distance to everything.Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: LizzyP_915
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Key West, my husband and I were initially looking at staying one of the many chain resorts but couldn't find one within our budget and that seemed to have all the ammenties we were looking for (in Old Town Key West, breakfast). Ater seeking advice from a friend who's been many times (and stayed at the Key Lime Inn) we booked Lighthouse Court (Key Lime did not have any rooms available at the time). We actually booked a Sunset Sail package for $500 which included the cruise and 3 nights stay (with breakfast). What a deal! After having gotten acquainted with the island, we are VERY happy that we didn't book a resort and pay a lot more given the quality of this B&B and it's prime location (right across from the Ernest Heminway museum) and a block from Duval. The staff that we encountered during our stay was very friendly! My only (very minor) complaint is that I had to call 3x's to get a confirmation emailed to me upon booking. Wouldn't change a thing upon our next trip to KW!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: princess7of9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night in Key West. It was great - really good location close to Hemmingway's house, a few minutes walk to Duval Street but in a lovely quiet street itself. Breakfast was a bit basic and the room , although large had no outlook and no outside seating area unlike a lot of the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B”
Reviews.Author: gypsyred
Reviews.Content: quiet--clean--great location--wonderful spot for couples---next to Key West lighthouse

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: bobthoman
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned home from a wonderful stay at the Lighthouse Court. It is located near everything, a great location. The office staff, Jacamo and Bonnie were friendly, helpful and made our stay enjoyable. Angel, the Property Manager was very accomodating, and Sonya our room attendent left the room clean and well tended to. We liked the morning continental breakfast and the great pool and cafe area. We really can't say anthing negative about our stay. It was very relaxing and enjoyable. I will miss our little chicken friend "Oprah" who greeted us daily. Please take good care of her! We hope to see everyone again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at the Lighthouse Court”
Reviews.Author: hotbeef801
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here and the first time we had the Ernest Hemmingway suite which is rather like a loft studio apt. I highly reccomend it if you can afford it. This time being on a much tighter budget we stayed in King room which was facing the front and had a very nice porch. It was a tight room and no closet bathroom being nice and of ample size very nice shower. Location for us is perfect right across from the Ernest Hemmingway House. Pool and grounds very nice. Front desk very polite. The breakfast is mediocre so know that going in. Good for pre breakfast coffee and light snack.Fpr the price it was very nice and would stay there again depending on my budget.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed for 7 days”
Reviews.Author: SanRay5258
Reviews.Content: this was our third time visiting key west in the last year and half, we love it and have been very happy in the past with our choices of accomodation but were looking for a new place with a pool with full sun which was offered with the lighthouse, we had specifically requested a pool side room as we love to lay by the pool during the day and venture out in the evening,we did not get the room we requested they kept telling us that they were really busy and would try to get us the room we wanted never happen, for 4 of our 7 days our sunning was interrupted with the entertained that was scheduled by the pool, it is a small area so all the equippent and chairs for the public came first instead of the quest wanting to enjoy the pool, we were not advised when we booked that we would not have the use of the area around the pool for lounging due to the entertainment, we loved the idea of the entertainment but the venue was way to small to accomodate both... there customer service is extremely poor, the grounds are not maintained, twice large branches from the palm trees fell almost on top of us and were never cleared, we had to continously ask to have our room cleaned, they would give fresh towels but never cleaned the room or the bathroom unless we requested, the only good thing i can say about this place is about Alex who works in there cafe/bar very nice and friendly, the continental breakfast very poor in variety, the cleaning staff were always either sitting or watching the tv's in the room rather than cleaning, i could go on and on, about why you should not stay here..grounds need upkeep, cleaning staff need to be reevaluated, the rooms are small and the office staff need to understand what customer service means, politeness and courtesy go a long way, we do not have high expectation, we put alot of time in trying to find the right place we were so disappointed and we even called to speak directly with them to ensure everything we were looking for was available... but there advertising and there word is not what you get especially for what you pay, we will definitely not be staying here again there are so many great places just don't choose this one!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn, very very small standard room.”
Reviews.Author: nab1110
Reviews.Content: Nice location, the pool was clean, other guests were friendly. The bar was nice the bartender friendly and helpful. The landscarping toward where we were by the pool needed a lot of work. The room a standard, was so small the full size bed took up the whole room. We later found out it was the smallest room in the Inn - which I wish we would have know because we would have asked for a larger room. Don't ever take J2, besides the size it needed renovation badly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: teteny
Reviews.Content: I have been to Key West five times and the most important thing I look for in a hotel is cleanliness and location. This hotel is not a luxury hotel, but is does have the charm and beauty that is so typical of Key West. The location is absolutely perfect. Walking distance to alll the attractions on Duval St. There is abike rental place one block away and it is right around the corner from Blue Heaven, which is the best brunch anywhere in the US. The pool area is nice and they do serve a light breakfast in the morning. Pool area was quiet and not packed. I am plannin on staying at this hotel when I return to Key West in November.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, relaxing stat”
Reviews.Author: JustSam82
Reviews.Content: What a cute little place. One block from Duval street, across from Hemingway's house, down the road from mile marker 0... Very peaceful, very clean, great location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: amy_dave
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night in Key West and were so happy to have booked to stay at the Lighthouse Court. We are from Canada and were visiting family in Florida and decided last minute to book a night in Key West for a two day trip. It was really easy to book the room and we even received a room upgrade upon arrival. The location of the hotel was perfect as we enjoyed being close to Duval St. while being off the beaten path. We had our own front porch to enjoy the beautiful evening air and morning coffee and paper. The room was very clean and the poolside continental breakfast was very generous. Like I said, "Perfect"

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for us”
Reviews.Author: jesusuk
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Key West in early March and were thrilled to stay at the Lighthouse Court. The last time we were in Key West, we stayed at a B&B a bit further inland. When we peeked into the Lighthouse Court to see what the grounds looked like, we were greeted by an employee that suggested we look around, hang at the bar, take a dip in the pool. She even got us towels to use. We were so impressed by their generosity, that we knew that's where we wanted to stay the next time we visited. After reading some of the reviews here, we were a bit worried that we had made a mistake. But our stay could not have been better and we're already trying to finagle our way back down there. We stayed in an updated room and found it to be delightful. I would certainly recommend you ask for one. Our room had it's own front porch that looked directly onto the Hemingway House. We used it every morning to eat our breakfast, read and plan out our day. We were worried about the noise of being right on top of Whitehead Street, but we slept like babies every night and never even used the complimentary ear plugs. Special Thanks to Alex in the bar and Jacomo at the front desk for making the stay so pleasant and easy going. Only recommendation I have (which has already been noted here) is toiletry space in the bathroom. I thought I was brilliant when I solved this dilemma by pulling up the blinds and placing our things on the window will. But when we returned to our room, we found that anything could melt did. Give us a shelf. Other than that, this place was phenomenal and we'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Great location - has 'character'”
Reviews.Author: nj_professional_cpl
Reviews.Content: It was really nice. Look - the shower was mediocre at best, our room was tiny (though i think there are larger ones and we didn't spend much time there anyway) and and the service was spotty (our room rarely made up before late afternoon). That all out of the way, we actually loved it. we're typically "big hotel" people, so staying here sight-unseen was a bit of going out on a limb for us. It's small - but friendly - and if you're out and about every night it's nice to come back to. the pool area is small but very pleasant for a swim after the day's activities or in the AM. The staff was mostly very nice, and genuine. It's a bit quirky, but it's clean, what you see is what you get, the location was great, and somehow the whole thing worked for us. I'd definitely recommend, unless you're really the type who need to be at a Hilton or a Marriott at all times. Oh - we were never woken up by roosters. We brought ear plugs after reading reviews, but it just didn't happen.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, friendly staff, relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: dave801_11
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights, had a wonderful time. Great atmosphere perfect location opposite Hemingways house. Friendly and very helpful staff Could do with better curtains to block outside light out of bedroom

Reviews.Title: “Needs some renovations and wifi”
Reviews.Author: Vacationplease411
Reviews.Content: Despite the comments below there are a few good things about the Lighthouse Court - It is to the beach and Duval street, and its quiet. The hotel advertised wifi and when we asked why it was not working we were told to sit by the office and it should work. Really? one would expect the wifi to work in your room.... The ceiling fan in the room was broken. There was no way to get fresh air in the room without opening the front door...since all of the windows were screwed shut. Wood and other construction materials were pilled up outside our bathroom window. The continental breakfast was not worth eating and was set up to late for us anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean room.”
Reviews.Author: columbiasctjh
Reviews.Content: The room was pricey at 259 plus tax and other room charges, but the location could not be better. One block off Duval Street, about 6 blocks from the southernmost marker east and about 14 blocks from Mallory Square west. Directly across the street from Hemmingway House. The staff could use some courtesy skills but all businesses in Key West appear to be so used to tourists, they have developed an "I don't care I'll never see you again anyway" attitude. Roosters crow all night but you get used to it as they run wide on the island. By the way they promise free parking but for a 40 room hotel they have about 6 parking places. If these are full you have to find your own parking on the street. Good luck with that!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: ChathamMass
Reviews.Content: Location of the property is excellent - one block from Duvall Street, across the street from the Hemingway House, offering a little more peace and quiet, yet still in the heart of the action. The pool and bar are convenient and most of the staff are friendly and helpful. Our room was very small and sparse but the bathroom was large. We booked at the last minute however and believe there are larger rooms. A simple breakfast is included. We recommend this property for the location, cleanliness of the rooms and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place stay....except”
Reviews.Author: shilohbog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lighthouse B&B last week and the location was perfect! We stayed in a single king room and it was wonderful EXCEPT the bed was extremely hard....The courtyard was perfect.....EXCEPT the cafe/Bar was being renovated.....and the sounds of table saws and hammering all day was not relaxing AT ALL.......BUT the bartender ALEX was outstanding and made the best of it.....He was polite and had a great sense of humor(he made our stay...enjoyable).......the pool was very nice and plenty of lounge chairs to relax on!! I would recommend this B&B........BUT should get new beds!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with cute rooms”
Reviews.Author: mecvo
Reviews.Content: Pricy but very nice hotel. Located near Duval street. Parking is free if you can find a public parking spot. Breakfast with bread, muffins, english muffins, bagels, yoghurt and cereal. Coffee, milk, orange juice. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a group to stay, great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: BetsygEastAurora
Reviews.Content: We were at the Light House Court as a group to attend a wedding. The staff was so friendly and helpful, the courtyard was so great for a large group, we enjoyed the patio bar and the wonderful bartender. The room layout was perfect! We would certainly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Key West”
Reviews.Author: jbmorf
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lighthouse Court in Key West was a nice get away for us. The hotel is quiet except for the chickens in the morning but they add a little country to our stay. Close to the downtown nice walking distance to Duval St and other attractions. Rooms were clean the hotel itself is very nice. We will be back and plan on bringing our friends. Only thing we didn't like is the parking .

Reviews.Title: “Clean historic buildings in a nice landscaped setting.”
Reviews.Author: Athierry2
Reviews.Content: Room was large and comfortable, clean and nice bathroom. convenient location. Well maintained property. Parking should be mentioned when booking for people driving to Key west.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Funinthesun10034088
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my sister's bachelorette party. I'll list out the pro's and con's Pro's: Our rooms were very clean. The pool area is gorgeous. The location was perfect considering we were out on Duval. Con's: The roosters were soooooo loud and couldn't get a good night sleep. Bring ear plugs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value at a great location”
Reviews.Author: msamma
Reviews.Content: I am specifically reviewing room E8 at The Lighthouse Court. I mention this because another couple we were traveling with was in one of the C-rooms and it looked like it had been recently renovated. My hunch is that the rooms vary heavily. The one right next door looked mighty nice as well (E7?). Our room was a Queen Suite. It was a tired room, but clean. A word of warning - the mattress is like concrete. It overlooks the pool courtyard on one side so you can hear noisy people at breakfast, but most of the time we were up by then anyway (breakfast is 8:30 to 10:30). It had a microwave, small fridge and kitchen area. I didn't sleep on the fold out couch, but it was fine to sit on. Nice high ceilings in the livingroom with lots of windows.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Lighthouse Court!”
Reviews.Author: charts
Reviews.Content: My 3 night stay was very nice. Great location, directly across from Hemingway House on Whitehead, one block from Duval. I stayed in a poolside deluxe king room. Pretty much a standard room with king bed. The room could use some updating and carpet cleaning. Bed was great. Flat screen TV was nice. Morning breakfast was standard fare. Good coffee and OJ. Staff was very nice and helpful. Easy check in/out. There is a poolside bar that had great service with a lunch menu. I have stayed at all the other Historic Inns. This place has its own personality-good vibe! Very quiet and relaxing! I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lighthouse Court was a great choice for us”
Reviews.Author: Lewy8
Reviews.Content: The location was great and it was why I chose this B & B. Located on Whitehead Street & Truman Avenue, one block behind Duval Street and directly across from the Hemingway House, everything is within walking distance. We arrived on Friday night, and it was pretty quiet around there. We were upgraded from a standard room to a king room with a private porch. Our room was on the far south end, right next to the actual lighthouse, and facing Whitehead Street. We could sit on the porch and watch the people walking up and down Whitehead, touring the Hemingway House, etc. Our room was nice, but basic. There was no closet, or armoire so we could not hang anything on hangers...not a big issue, because you're in Key West, and it is CASUAL!!! The bathroom was well lit, and did have a good hair dryer. My hair is quite long, and even though it is small, it was plenty powerful enough. I wished there was a small shelf or 2 to place some necessities on, but again, not a big deal...keeping things in my bag when I was done with them, keeps me from forgetting things and leaving them behind. The biggest surprise to me was how much activity there was out front on Whitehead Street during the day. This was not a super busy time of year, but even so, quite early each morning, I would wake up to the sounds of people chatting and bustling by outside. If you hate mornings, and love to sleep in, ask for a room with more privacy than these on the front of the property, with a private porch. All-in-all we throughly enjoyed our stay, had no issues, and found the Lighthouse Court an excellent choice especially for the going rates of single rooms in Old Town. Oh, I almost forgot...the bed was very firm, but not uncomfortable. But if you prefer to "sink" into your bed, may want to ask if they have pillowtop mattresses available and choose one of those rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioner/heater”
Reviews.Author: merryreader
Reviews.Content: When we arrived it was the coldest since the 1800's and we bundled up with the extra blankets the office supplied at our request. If the microwave plug-in hadn't accidentally blew the wall circuit out, we never would have know, if it had'nt been for the maintenance man, that the air conditioner is also a heater. But seeings how the air conditioner/heater is about 12 feet off the floor, we couldn't see the controls to regulate it. We had to balance ourselves on the edge of the bed to even reach the controls. So maintenance got the heat on for us. When the weather warmed up, we called the front desk to change it over from hot to cold and they never came. Luckily we had made friends with a couple in another room and the tall man helped us out. It would have been nice to have had windows that opened. We were on the ground floor. It was a comfortable, quiet and private place to stay. I probably won't stay there again because of the price(which I knew when I booked).

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: retiredandlovingit07
Reviews.Content: This is our 1st stay at this inn, but we've stayed at another from the Historic Key West Inn operation. This location is convenient and much quieter than the Truman Street inns. (It's right across the street from Hemingway's house.) The rooms are well-appointed with comfortable beds and bedding, clean and spacious bathrooms, a nice continental breakfast by the pool, and a bar/luncheon spot that is open for several hours each day. Sitting in the courtyard during midday is quite pleasant! The homemade Key Lime Pie is great! The staff is very helpful, too. Bike rental places, shops, and restaurants are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Most Comfortable stay I have ever had in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Steffey123
Reviews.Content: I loved loved my visit with you. Your staff was so friendly, your rooms were comfortable and very homey - great location and we felt at home. Cannot wait to come back and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: michiganmand
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights here on a trip to Florida trying to escape the cold of Michigan. Got here on a record-setting cold day. And it warmed up only marginally until the day we left. I picked the Lighthouse hotel because of its location and largely positive reviews. Now afterwards, I'm a little suspicious of some of the more glowing reviews, particularly any review that doesn't mention the hassle parking your car. Upon arriving rather late in the afternoon, the check-in clerk went over the pool hours, the continental breakfast and everything but didn't mention parking. I was currently at a meter about six blocks down, the closest I could get. When I asked about parking, the clerk asked rather incredulously, "You brought your car?" What, like guests usually parachute in for their stays? She said the limited parking at the hotel was full so I was on my own. I did see some vacant "residential" spaces nearby. Could I park there? "I wouldn't recommend it," was the response. So, what was I supposed to do? The clerk suggested I park at a pay lot for the night, then move to parallel park on the street closer to the hotel in the morning when there'd likely be more spots. The pay lot cost $20 and the attendant seemed surprised I wanted to leave the car, a new 2010 only a month-old, there for the night. But he let me and the next morning I was able to get a spot on Whitehead Street on the block next to our hotel. One reason people just leave their car parked for their stay and get around on foot or whatever is that they don't want to go through the hassle of finding a free spot again. I saw one lady standing in a vacant spot next to the hotel to reserve it while her husband retrieved their car. There are lots of transportation options once you do finally find parking--cabs, pedicab, rentals, walking--and nothing seems very far. But keep your car locked at all times. At night I saw shady locals checking out cars and one even trying the door to see if was locked. Tourist brochures describe this as close to an "urban" environment so take that for what it's worth. But nothing happened to our vehicle in the three days and nights we were there. Other than parking, the positives were the lovely landscaped grounds, the friendliness of the staff, the ideal location for exploring what Key West has to offer, and the cleanliness of the exterior spaces. On the downside, our TV didn't offer many of the channels advertised on the printed TV guide, the carpet seemed as if it hadn't been thoroughly cleaned in quite some time (which we discovered when cleaning up a spill), the combination heater/AC was difficult to reach and kicked out about as much heat as a 100-watt light bulb, the wi-fi only worked in certain rooms (not our's of course) and the thin walls are definitely not soundproof . Don't do or say anything you want your neighbors to hear. All in all, we did rate our stay positively, however. Key West has quite a diverse collection of activities to entertain, educate, and enjoy. Lighthouse Court Hotel is in an ideal location to it all. But its parking is not.

Reviews.Title: “The best way to describe the room is "Difficult."”
Reviews.Author: NotLadyGaga
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. That's about the only positive aspect of the Inn. I hate to be harsh but the reality of the room compared to what was online was quite a contrast. The room was small and very "difficult". There was no place to put anything! The bathroom sink provided enough room for a toothbrush. Hate to nitpick but seriously, stuff kept droppping on the floor, or in the sink. Bottom line, this place needs major updates: 1) Carpet, 2) Bathroom, 3) Bed, 4) Honest Ads. Our room was billed as a Superior Queen but there was nothing superior about it. Speaking of updates, that was actually taking place NEXT TO OUR ROOM during our stay. There was construction happening in at least two locations. Conveniently next to our room and out by the pool. I felt sorry for the bride-to-be who had a bunch of visitors in her suite only to be interrupted by the sound of construction.
