Bottom line: if you want a place just to lay your head (on an uncomfortable bed) near Duvall, then stay here. But you're still going to pay and you'll wake up with a back ache. Otherwise, pay a little more for all of the simple luxuries you would come to expect at an Inn. I guess I would have been happier if we were offered a discount for having to stay right next to a construction zone and for have an old, outdate room. I didn't ask. Should have.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and central”
Reviews.Author: leejack87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice and will def return. Relaxing clapperboard style with small pool and free continental breakfast. Mins walk from all the bars and places to eat but also felt quiet enough for a good nights sleep. The rooms seemed to be in the process of being updated which maybe a good idea for some of the rooms. One small problem: why no shelf in the bathroom to place your toiletries on and am I the only person who banged my chins on the odd shaped bed legs?

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for your wedding party”
Reviews.Author: natmatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel's Hemingway Suite for 3 days for our wedding. It is Â more of a hotel than a b&b. I had booked around 10 rooms at a 10% discounted rate. Â Denice set up our contract around 9 months before we were to stay there. I was extremely disappointed that she wouldn't budge more on extending the discount rate a few months. Â All of our 10 guest rooms needed to be booked 8 months in advance to get the meager 10% discount, this resultedÂ in a good deal of our guests opting to stay at another nearby B&B, the Angelina instead.Â  Pros: â€¢The suite rooms my guests were in were very nicely decorated and roomy.Â  â€¢The staff is very helpful and kind. Bonnie was very nice.Â  â€¢The chickens roaming the breakfast area offered lots of entertainment to my nephew.Â  â€¢The grounds were kept clean and the towels were soft and fluffy.Â  â€¢The Hemingway Suite was fully outfitted with a complete kitchen (full sized stove and refridgerator, dishes and silverwear), washer and dryer, iron, ironing board and a hairdryer.Â  â€¢The bed was very comfortable with new white sheets.Â  Cons â€¢The standard rooms are very small. And the suite my sister stayed in had a worn in shower.Â  â€¢The door to the Hemingway Suite was really difficult to open.Â  â€¢Since they don't book you into a room until you get there when my guests wanted to extend their stay the staff there had no idea if they already had a reservation and was booking them into a new room. Caused a lot of confusion. The process of booking and billing could be improved.Â  â€¢They seem to have a bad termite problem at night and several bugs including a palmetto bug were found in my parents suite.Â  â€¢Located centrally was great except that the weddings at the Hemingway house on Saturday were really loud and Â ran until 11:30 which irritated several of my older guests.Â  â€¢There is a handicap suite however it only has 1 bed. My husbands 90 year old grandparents were burdened with walking all the way to the back of the hotel to their room with 2 beds on 1 flight, going past the pool's rickety deck and up 3 steps, which did not have a railing! â€¢They did nothing special for us regarding my group reservation, no champagne or note or acknowledgement of our wedding.Â

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Ginagar01
Reviews.Content: Quaint, private, great pool and staff.... I have book them again for 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Dreamvacation in Key West”
Reviews.Author: krippe
Reviews.Content: Great vacation of a lifetime dream, all the way from Sweden.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Key West Inns”
Reviews.Author: RiKatie
Reviews.Content: Particularly the LIghthouse although we have stayed at Albury Court as well and that was wonderful. The pool, decks and outdoor atmosphere is wonderful. the rooms are comfortable and have all the space you need in Key West. We look forward to going back annually.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place but not for families”
Reviews.Author: needinfo81
Reviews.Content: I booked lighthouse court as it was a cute, quaint place which it was but it is not suitable if you have little kids. Parking was a pain and standard room was too small. I would stay there again if I had no kids with me

Reviews.Title: “WHAT ARE THESE PEOPLE SMOKING?”
Reviews.Author: blackluna27
Reviews.Content: Seriously, I guess we all have different expectations. For 150.00 + tax I was expecting something a little better than a motel 8. The carpet was gross, the room was tiny and smelled like mildew. With the money that they make they should seriously update the place. Take off that dirty carpet, polish the wood floors, buy better mattresses and towels. The staff was nice and the location was close to Duval and the bars, which you really need, that way when you lay down on the crappy mattress in the stinky room it wont matter! Maybe these other people stayed in a better room, when I asked to be moved they wanted to charge us sixty dollars more for almost the same type room- I used the money to get drunk and forget about the poor choice we just made and made the best out of my much needed vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, friendly staff, cleanliness could be better”
Reviews.Author: Tiki6
Reviews.Content: We have visited in Key West many times, staying at other places in the area as well as closer to Mallory Square and Trumbo Point. Lighthouse Court won us over by its great location near our favorite local eateries; Blue Heaven and Le Creperie. The staff at the registration desk were very helpful in assisting us with obtaining parking as we arrived late and the property had no available parking places. The next day, we were able to park on the property. The only advice is to not use the room safes. (We used the safe to keep the housekeeping staff from going through our valuables but when we checked out the last day, the safe was empty. Hubby assumed I retrieved our stuff and vice versa. When we arrived home, we realized the goods were left behind. A call to the front desk revealed nothing turned in. We lost a camera, a Bible, some inexpensive 14-kt earrings and some costume jewelry as well as my husband's Agenda book for work with all his account numbers and phone numbers. We felt violated that the housekeepers had access to the safes all along! Again, great place to stay but don't bring what you can't keep on you at all times! Otherwise a pleasant stay (the roosters didn't bother us at all; we slept well!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: Bcra1g
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lighthouse Court for my first trip to Key West. My best friend decided to get married and we all stayed there. It was close to everything and still quiet. The staff made you feel at home and the rooms were awesome! My shower was so big, there was no door needed!!!!! I will return and the Lighthouse will be where I rest my head!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MMH28
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! Had a great room with a semi-private deck viewing the lighthouse. It was quiet although only a block from the main street. Close to everything â€” we biked everywhere the entire time. The staff was fabulous! When I go back to lovely Key West I plan to stay here again. What a lovely island, what lovely, friendly people, what a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: mccattle
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here four times and going back for a fifth. Very relaxing around the pool during the day and a short walk to the night life of Duval street and great restuarants. Walk down to Tropical rentals and get bikes and tour Old Town

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bluedog012
Reviews.Content: Accomodations were delightful. Thinking we would have 2 queen beds in one room you can only imagine our excitement when we arrived to a bungelow with bedroom upstairs and second queen downstairs. Room never cooled properly-extremely hot week of stay. Staff were very pleasant. Loved the open pool area with restaurant and bar. Kudos to staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Sherrykhanum
Reviews.Content: I went here for my birthday in April with my boyfriend and 2 of our friends. The rooms were small, but very comfortable. Key West is really humid and hot but the AC kept this place ultra cold. The shower is small (1 person only!) but it does the job. Room service was great. The location is the best part though. We went to key west to party, and this place is literally 10 minutes away from all the bars. We took our cars but we didnt even need them during the whole trip! The hemmingway house is right across the street which is great. You can see cute little weddings on weekend nights!

Reviews.Title: “Your Missing Out!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunChaser1967
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Lighthouse Court in as many years and I can't wait to get back!! For the ones that have read some of the negative views and decide to pass on this place, your missing out. If your into luxuries that the Four Season's or the huge resorts offer than this is probably not your place but if your into the quite, secluded, quiant and relaxing places than this is it. Yes, there are areas that could use a little repair here and there and yes there are things that could be better but you will not find a more accomodating hotel. From the time we checked in with Bonnie until the time we checked out 7 days later, we could not have asked for anything more. They even tried to upgrade us for free but we enjoyed our smaller room and its secluded location that we opted to stay put! We had a front porch that looked out across the street to Hemingway's house and the Lighthouse was just a few feet to our side (Room H1). The pool is adequate in size and the bartenders, Beth and Alex were great!! The hotel is located one block off of Duval so you are within walking distance to nearly everyhting. If you don't feel like walking a $4 p/p or less cab ride will get you anywhere you need to go. The housekeeping was excellent. They even found a watch we thought we had lost!! They sometimes did not have the room cleaned until later in the day but we didn't care. We were out in the pool or sightseeing!! The tropical gardens are beautiful and yes, just like all of Key West there are roosters and chickens running loose! Accidentally left my credit card at checkout but I got a phone call from the front desk while we were having lunch on Duval and dropped back buy to retrieve it. Only negative thing I can say about this place is parking. I have never had a car while I was visiting in Key West, the past 20 years, but I would say that space is very limited onsite. They double park so you have to leave your keys with the front desk if you are blocking someone else in. Again, I could go on and on, but this place is what Key West is about. It has character and a style all of its own. If you really want to experience Key West then this place is a must stay! I am about to book another return trip for December!! This place is also only a couple of blocks from The Blue Heaven restaurant which is a must for breakfast!! Don't pass this place up!! It is a great value as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Its a 50/50!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiPolo87
Reviews.Content: I must say that I am 50/50 on this.. The good thing is the staff is helpful and nice,the room I felt was pretty cozy but couldve been a bit bigger. Especially if you have a lot of luggage!! The bath room was a nice size but the shower is HORRIBLY small :-( Bed was nice and comfortable. View was good I gotta admit. The location of the hotel is a little walk to Duval St and where everything happends but it is far enough to where you don't hear anything so you can have a good nights sleep,but don't worry if you do hear anything because the hotel provides you ear plugs! The hotel could be upgraded alot! The deck was horribly uneven and holes and not a good place to walk barefooted (If you wanted too). I will say breakfast was good and the hang out space in the middle of the hotel is very nice.. I wouldnt recommend hanging out at night due to the major problems with the bugs.. Thankfully I didn't stay much in the hotel due to sight seeing and night life but for the time I was there it was alright...

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Timo315
Reviews.Content: First impression of the hotel was not good. No parking at all!! Opon arrival to the front desk (The olny good part of the hotel). As I recieve my keys,and information from Mike (Which he was really helpful) He let me know that parking was full and that I would not be able to park for my stay,so I went ahead and parked 2 blocks away and paid 40 bucks for 2 days. After my long walk back,finally happy to reach my room,I once again was sadend.. Room was extremely small for the price it was being sold at.. The curtin to cover the door,didn't cover the door completely,no fridge,small closet for 2 guests,and the shower was EXTREMELY small!! After hitting my elbow 40 times in the shower,I decided to sit outside on the tree swing,only to be attacked by huge flying roaches,mosquitos and frogs. Talk about eww! As I came back from a night out I went to sleep and I slept good I must say and there bed is comfortable. As I woke up to open the window,I had a nice view of the lighthouse (One of the few good things about the hotel). Walked out to breakfast which was average. It had your everyday starch of breakfast items. As I sat outside after breakfast,I noticed a lot of holes and uneven wood flooring. In the afternoon,after returning from tours we finally got in the pool. Kinda disappointed the bar was already closed. When I asked Mike why,he said they close at 6:30.. Problem with that is I was in the pool around 5. So that was a let down.. The pool was average,a bit small to swim in. After getting ready to go out for dinner,I sat once again on the deck and it was attack of the flying roaches,mosquitos,and frongs part 2. After running back in the room (lol) I notiched the bathroom had a trail of little ants. After 2 nights, a early checkout was done. Inconclusion I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. Standard I expected was much higher and not met. I would recommend that you spend 40 dollars more on a hotel and be closer to the action,away from the bugs,with a more spacious room,and more bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a quaint place with old-fashioned charm”
Reviews.Author: Rzknow
Reviews.Content: Staying at Lighthouse Court is a nice change of pace from the Hyatt, Hiltons and Marriott's of the world. It is a bunch of old building but the rooms were updated and comfortable. It is the perfect location 1 block off Duval street. We had one issue with plumbing while we were there, but Andy and the management team took care of us for the inconvenience. I would definitely recommend this, but hope it doesn't get too popular because we want to go back! We stayed in the suite right in front of the pool. While we were initially concerned that there would be lack of privacy, but it worked out fine and never felt crowded of concerned that my toddler was bothering anyone. We had a 2 yr old with us and there was enough space in the courtyard and our room that we felt like we had our 'own' apartment for the week. You must try the Key Lime Margaritas, they are GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at a hostel - about 1/4th of price, and probably just as good”
Reviews.Author: JonW_62
Reviews.Content: The one thing that this hotel in it's favor is LOCATION. It is superbly situated, directly opposite the Hemmingway House, and 2 blocks from Duval Street. That is really all that it has in it's favor. Check- in experience was very poor. Made to pay for entire stay at check-in! (Hey, nice to be trusted, eh?). Long walk to room, with bags - NO offer for any porter to help. Parking is NON-EXISTENT. Be very aware of this. You will have to unload bags, then go and find a street parking place as close as you can - and good luck with that! Rooms VERY small. Nothing wrong with them, if you are a dwarf. They were clean and tidy, but really you could not swing a cat. Very pricey for a room of this quality. Pool area very small, and far too close to the rooms. People are enjoying themselves by the pool, obviously. The noise of this means that you get little rest in your room if you like peace and quiet. Bar area at pool has limited selection. However, very nice barkeep who was really helpful, professional and polite. Sadly, he was totally overworked as this bar needs two people to run it at busy times, but hotel is too cheap to employ a 2nd barkeep. Prices at bar were reasonable. This hotel has nothing actually wrong with it, it just isn't anything special - but sadly their prices assume that they are. I hate not being trusted at a hotel I have booked (especially when cost of first night has already been debited) and the check in experience really stuck in my throat. If you are prepared to pay a BIG premium for location, then this is for you. Next time I will stay further out at a comfortable hotel, for less money, and use the money i save to take Taxi cabs into Duvall Street. Really NOT recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - that is about it”
Reviews.Author: JennieHernandez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled to Key West several times and we have stayed in several locations on the island, but this one by far been the most disappointing. I was very excited to stay at this location, especially based on the seemingly positive reviews I had read on tripadvisor. I booked the hotel from the historic key west inn's website, primarily for it's location - which is across the street from the Hemingway house. We arrived on a Friday afternoon and planned to check out on Sunday, I was ready to leave that night. My husband and I went to dinner, and upon return we asked if we could just check out the next morning - we were rudely informed by the evening clerk at the desk that it is a 2 night minimum so was were basically screwed. He said we could talk to the manager in the AM, but that it probably wouldn't be of help. The negatives - a hotel should not promote free parking when there are not enough spaces available for the amount of rooms that they have. They have 10 maybe 12 spaces - I could just assume since no one spot ever became available during our visit. We were directed to a few "pay" lots several blocks away, but my husband and I were fortunate to find some free street parking about 3 blocks away. There is free street parking outside the hotel itself, but based on the dust & condition of the majority of the vehicles - they have been there for a long time. We stayed in room B2. The room was located on the deck level above the pool. The room was worn, musty, and was full of stains. The furniture was old and worn, there was no way to control the overhead ceiling fan which was on the whole time ( and humming). Both windows (bathroom & in main room) had broken locks on the windows which is a true safety concern. I am not sure how you are expected to have a goodnight sleep knowing that your windows do not lock. The free continental breakfast served was a true joke - it was carb central - apples, bagels, english muffins and fiber yogurt. The poor area had a cute little bar & snack shop. They also had a not so cute sign that NO OUTSIDE FOOD OR DRINK can be consumed at the pool area - um yeah - sorry dude, I am drinking my own water - thank you We never did make to to talk to the manager - so we sucked it up and stayed the additional night. For the amount I paid for 1 night, I could have stayed a hotel like La Concha on Duval (with garunteed parking) for an extra $20/night. I do want to acknowledge one of the clerks the morning we checked out. Her name was Denice I believe. She asked how we enjoyed our stay and I think she may have regretted she had. We explained our concerns to her and she sincerely felt bad and attempted to rectify the situation - at that point it was a little too late. If you a are looking for a hotel in Key West with a great location - are arriving with no car and plan to spend no time in your room - then this is your place..... if you are looking to really relax, stay in a place that should be more for the money, and spend time enjoying the ammenities - then this is NOT the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “We made our reservation over the phone and when we arrived learned they had held the rooms for the wrong day.”
Reviews.Author: Trippysloomis
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in our experience. When I called to make a reservation for two rooms for a holiday weekend the person on the phone was rude and condescending. Against my better judgment I went ahead with the reservation and was given two confirmation numbers. When our group of six showed up to check in we learned that the person I spoke to had made the reservations for the wrong dates. There were no rooms available for the dates we wanted had originally requested. We were lucky to find rooms at another location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: JaysonandMaggie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night and could have stayed longer! Great rooms awesome people! Great food and drinks at the bar, a lot of homade mixes and the salad dressing yummy!! Two blocks from Duvall and attractions. Right across from the hemming way house. Close enough to party but far enough for peaceful sleep! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lost it's Luster”
Reviews.Author: lacciani11
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this place is on a slow decline. It was nice a few years ago when we stayed here but not any more. The decking is dangerous,boards are rotting away. When we were there there was a rowdy group that got drunk and noisy and no one did anything about it.They broke all the "rules" yet were able to dominate the pool area. Too bad it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very romantic.”
Reviews.Author: afloyd508
Reviews.Content: The Lighthouse Court is a perfect place to stay in Key West. It is only a block away from Duval St. so it is close enough to walk anywhere you need to go but away from the crowds. It is very quaint and the rooms are tucked away for privacy and you are surrounded by tropical growth. Friendly, knowledgeable staff with will happily tell you where to go "off the beaten path."

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: scottrm612
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks excellent when you first walk in. Walk to the back deck, but be careful you donâ€™t trip on the unsecured and wobbly planking. The room (#F3) had holes at the bottom of the walls where the walls met the baseboard. The bathroom was just plain wore out. The tile was excessively worn and there was no place to put your bathroom appliances (toothbrush, razor, makeup etc.). The second day we were greeted with a fresh torn bath towel replacement when they made up the room. The morning breakfast was OK. It could have been better if they had fresh fruit and non-cardboard bagels. The pool was hotter than the outside temp ( 96F+). A friend of ours had the TV on at night but had to turn it off from the hovering termites that were attracted to the light. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet respite from Duvall Street”
Reviews.Author: MNPurvis
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Lighthouse Court. With the exception of the island chickens crowing at all hours of the morning, it was quiet and serene. Staff was helpful and very friendly. The location was ideal - close enough to the action of Duvall, but not loud or rowdy.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel-perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sora21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and easy to drive to. Only negatives are the parking...there are only 10 spots available and it's first come first park. Also, you block in people when you park so you have to leave your car keys at the front desk in case the other car needs to get out.. The other problem was the bathroom. It was small, shower was tiny and the sink took forever to drain. On a positive note, the room was clean, we had clean towels, adjustable AC and a fan in the room. The age range of the clients was from early 20s to 50's. Everyone was nice.....no loud, drunk obnoxious people (which I have encountered at other hotels in KW). Oh, do not expect quick service with anything .....you're in key west so just relax and wait :)

Reviews.Title: “Just About Perfect”
Reviews.Author: chasenfratz
Reviews.Content: Lighthouse Court was just about perfect - the only thing that would make it perfect would be to add a hot tub! We were in Room C6. We really loved the loft arrangement and kitchen facilities. We bought food and drinks at a grocery store and saved a lot of money by packing picnic lunches and having pie and drinks in our room after dinner instead of at restaurants. Pool was nice, grounds beautiful and a peaceful refuge from the busy street, service fine, location great, I could walk to everything I wanted to do or walk to a bike rental place. Would definitely come here again. We loved our stay in Key West overall. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BaciBoy55
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Key West. The Lighthouse Court was a perfect spot to stay! A very cute and intimate place. It was very clean, the room was very nice too. We stayed in a suite, so that was perfect. The grounds were beautiful! It is only a block off of Duval Street, although from the 'real action' it's a little bit of a walk to get further down Duval to where the more action is. All of Duval has stuff going on, but the closer you get to the end of the street, the more that is going on. I would definitley stay again at the LIghthouse Court, we are already planning another trip next year staying here again. It is right across the street from the Hemingway house and next door to the historical LIghthouse. It's also just a short walk to the Southernmost Point. Stay here - you will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Al_travel_10
Reviews.Content: Was put in a room right behind the office, the bed was a double at best and harder than a concrete slab. Went to the office to tell them and was informed that it was a European Queen. No wonder we went with a Constitution-based federal republic. Would not stay here again and regret not just going with an old standby bed and breakfast I'd been going to for years in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A truly great experience! Defintely stay here!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveling22
Reviews.Content: I stood at the Hemingway suite at the lighthouse court ,it was actually for my wedding. First and foremost Let me start by complementing the staff!. The front desk rep Denise was amazing she helped me with all my questions and recommend various vendors for my wedding. The whole staff was so accommodating, they treated me and my spouse like we were family! Like I mentioned earlier we rented out the Hemingway suite which was Gorgeous, It was a little pricey but well worth it, It is very spacious and can fit easily about 6 comfortably (I fit about 50 people in there for my reception) I especially love the private entrance,wrap around porch,and the sundeck that over looks the Hemingway house and the lighthouse.Now lets talk about the basic rooms I had my family stay with us at lighthouse court. My parents room was the second best room besides mine it was a good size sleeps only two and has an upgraded shower and then my in laws had the deluxe suite which sleeps four comfortably, the room was spacious but outdated and my sister in law had a basic room by the courtyard and the room was a little small. Basically the average rooms are just ok but I will tell you this it is the BEST location we were litterally 1/2 a block away from duval we didnt have to drive anywhere. Please visit you won't regret it, I am dying to go back and the best beach to visit is Smathers Beach and the best place to eat is The conch republic ( they have the most fresh seafood) If you need anymore tips let me know : ) Happy Travels! Nikki

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Jaime08
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel, it offers the best of Key West, staff very friendly and perfectly located, mom loved it!. Chuck and Mike, great guys. Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Helped make our destination wedding so wonderful”
Reviews.Author: gillums2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed at Lighthouse Court on our first vacation together and had a great time. So when it came time to plan our destination wedding in Key West, we wanted to have our guest stay at Lighthouse Court also. The Group cordinator for the hotels, Denice, was amazing. She helped out with way more than rooms. I bet I called 30 times while planning rooms and she was always very pleasant and eager to help me. When we arrived to the hotel, they helped us get our gift bags to rooms before all the guest got there. All of the employees asked if there was anything I needed help with. And you couldn't pass an employee with hearing a hello, they didn't make us feel like tourists. More like neighbors. All of our guest loved their rooms and the property. It has a wonderful location, right near Duval St. but away from all the noise. Walking distance to the Southern Most Point, Blue Heaven right around corner, and our favorite the Green Parrot a couple blocks away. Just to name a few.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, well maintained tropical gardens with pet rooster....”
Reviews.Author: awgreen403
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Room was small, clean and functional. The drinks refigurator was a little small and not as cool as we liked. Gardens were well maintained and clean. The breakfast was adequate but the late afternoon drinks from the pool side bar were great..... The location was great opposite the Hemingway house and adjacent to the lighthouse. we rented bike during our visit but if you have a car parking could be an issue but the hotel parking space worked well for the last nght when we had a rental car, We would stay there again. Andrew and Louise from Pewaukee WI

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: tchaldeman
Reviews.Content: Overall, a decent play to stay...rooms are fairly basic, but seemed to be clean enough, and the location was very good...easy walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel, in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: NoleGrad97
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our tenth wedding anniversary, and from the moment we entered the hotel, we felt completely comfortable! We stayed in the Hemingway Suite, which was AMAZING! The room itself was spacious and comfortable, and the private porch was great for people watching. The staff was very helpful - Vicki suggested our FANTASTIC sunset sailing cruise, and Josh, the bartender, was great (I miss the key lime margaritas already!) The location was in walking distance to all of the main attractions (Southernmost Point, Duval Street, Hemingway House, Mallory Square), and a great place to stay if you want to be close to everything, but still have a relaxing setting.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chas123
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here and in Key West. The hotel was comfortable and very clean. The only thing that was disappointing about our suite, was there no dresser to put away clothes. Closet had no shelves. Living out of the suitcase was a drag. Otherwise, had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Our usual place in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: usndon
Reviews.Content: Where we stay whenever we're in Key West. Small, quaint, clean and friendly. Directly across the street from the Hemingway House and next door to the Lighthouse. Everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Tired”
Reviews.Author: BippyFalmouth_Me
Reviews.Content: To say this hotel is tired is putting it mildly....If I could have I would have checked out and not stayed we would have. Our room had one window looking out on a coke and ice machine...room dark and dreary..Rooms real small ...We paid $250.00 a night...It was a $79.00 room at best.I would not recomend this hotel to anybody....

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill very carefully”
Reviews.Author: Lincolnsinn
Reviews.Content: I was booked to stay here on 28 February 2010. As it turned out, due to a family illness, I couldn't travel so I called to cancel the room. I cancelled just outside the period for free cancellations. In other words, if I had cancelled one day earlier, there would have been no cancellation charge; as it was, they charged me full rate. I can't complain about that - They had made the terms and conditions clear to me when I booked. Still, I think they could have given me some leeway, as I was only booked for one night. The fact that they charged me full rate obviously means I wouldn't book there again in a million years. As I say, though, I can't complain about them charging full rate for a late cancellation. What I can complain about though, is the fact that they then added an extra 10% to their charges! I certainly had a surprise when I checked my credit card statement. The hotel itself might be great - it certainly looks nice from the reviews, which is why I booked it. My only experience of it is the hotel's customer service, though, which is not good at all. I would check your bill very carefully if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, quiet location, very good price”
Reviews.Author: TravelsAlot
Reviews.Content: What is special about this hotel is the staff. They take care of you. And while we were in Key West, we needed someone to do just that. We stayed in the Lighthouse Court for our daughter's wedding at the Hemingway House. We occupied 5 rooms during the stay. When you read the reviews, there are different sized rooms. For our guests, we chose king rooms, and found them to be very comfortable. For ourselves, we chose a suite, and it was very good. We were there during spring break season--the pool area is a quiet escape from the hustle of Duval street, and the hotel is close to pretty much everything. We found our rooms to be quiet and clean---except the Key West roosters, of course, which announce you are in Key West each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, quiet location and a little worn”
Reviews.Author: RTripper4
Reviews.Content: Lighthouse Court is a quiet, well run place with a variety of lodging options. It has the typical Key West feel to it, and the staff are helpful and accommodating. But it's seen it's best years and there is a wear factor that needs to be considered before booking. The rooms were very clean, but not very large. Even the King Delux room is pretty small. Don't get a room by the pool, unless you love the sound of Jimmy Buffet music 18 hours a day. Having said all that, if you can get a room for under $150 than you will get value for cost. I paid $225 +tax and that was too much. Not a gem, not a disaster...somewhere in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, Best price, Best view of the Lighthouse!”
Reviews.Author: aqua21az
Reviews.Content: This bed and breakfast hotel was the best choice I've ever made for our trip to Key West. We had the best view of the lighthouse. Its especially beautiful at night, surrounding the stars in the sky. During the day, you can relax in the hammock by the outdoor balcony. The next day, we enjoyed a wonderful continental breakfast by the pool. We felt really relaxed and trully enjoyed our stay. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: doctortuck
Reviews.Content: Came with wife and two other couples for our 30th anniverasry. Great place for couples or groups of friends. Once you walk into the courtyard behind the front desk area, you feel like you've been transported to a tropical island. Palm trees, a little pool, tables and chairs tucked away in little corners surrounded by lush foliage, and all in the center of the eclectic bunch of rooms. (everything from bare-bones bed and bath to upscale loft apartment with all the amenities). REALLY helpful front desk staff: arranged bike rentals, catamaran sail trip, taxi, dinner reservations with enthusiasm. Always a smile on their faces. Located about midway between Mallory Square and The Southernmost Point, so walking distance to all the fun stuff. Only drawback was the incessant nocturnal crowing of the itinerant roosters that seem to have taken over the whole island, but Hey: this is Key West, right? Wouldn't be the same without stuff you don't see at home...

Reviews.Title: “Only thing going for it is location!”
Reviews.Author: bobbi0101
Reviews.Content: Great location, historic inn, lots of discount activity and restaurant coupons, but you can get them anywhere. Room perfect for 1 person, but not 2; very small. 3/4 wall around bathroom, no privacy. Blinds instead of black-out drapes--let in way too much outside light at night. Very cold but air conditioning controls way out of my reach--had to stand on chair to turn it down. Very noisy wine cooler (yes, wine cooler!); finally had to turn it off. Breakfast not until 8:30--not worth the wait. Although we had "Please service room" tag on outside of door, they never did service our room. Free parking, however they held the car keys. Had to make sure to get them early the night before we left since they don't arrive until 8:00 AM and we had to leave before then. Although listed in AAA, does not offer discount; definitely not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kelann
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite charming, nicely decorated living area and relatively modern bathrooms. We only stayed one night, but the kitchenette in the room would be great for those staying a few days. You can't beat the location -- right across the street from Hemingway's House, away from the Duval St. madness. It's an easy walk to Duval Street and the Southernmost Point. Loved it, would stay again. More appealing than the chain hotels. Breakfast was included, but very basic -- juice and muffins. The hotel parking lot is small, paid $20 to park in a lot 3 blocks away when we arrived in the afternoon. We were able to move the car to a free street spot directly in front of the hotel the next am.

Reviews.Title: “it was perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: 33sun33
Reviews.Content: The lighthouse has a great location - across from the Hemmingway house, and a block from Duval. The room itself was fine, although it felt a bit like a cave due to lack of light. The temp was only in the 50s and 40s during our stay (sucks!), so we had no opportunity to use the pool area. The pool itself is pretty small, but the lounge areas seemed nice (nice hammock areas). The continental breakfast left much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we ever stay”
Reviews.Author: sbrady2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Boca and travel down to Key West at least 4 times a year, even if just for a weekend. We have stayed at all the big resorts like the Hyatt on front street, the Crowne Plaza La Concha and the Reach Resort. While all these places are nice, we found the Lighthouse Court by accident during a quick 2 night stay, and we have not stayed at ANY other resort since. The location of this inn is fantastic. Its proximity to all the restaurants, shops, ft zach beach, the southernmost point and sunset celebration are perfect. We have bikes waiting for us as soon as we check in, and are always treated as family during our visit. The pool is quaint, but perfect. The guests are always so nice (you will meet some new friends during breakfast our at the pool for afternoon cocktails). Breakfast every morning is such an added benefit, as meals can be expensive in the keys. Whether you are looking for a quick get-a-way or a romantic stay, this is the perfect inn! Room A2 (a king suite with mini kitchenette, living room and your own private porch) is our favorite spot! So private and upgraded!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: AZHappyTravelers
Reviews.Content: We recently got married in Key West and 20 of my friends and family took up about 9 rooms ranging from single rooms up to the Hemmingway Suite at Lighthouse. Denice did a great job accomodating us all and offered a nice discounted rate. It's not a 5 star hotel, but we knew that from the beginning. However, it was very clean, the grounds were well kept and even though the pool was small, it got plenty of sun and provided a really nice central area for us all to hang out. We had breakfast by the pool every morning and it was a good start to the day. We had our reception in the Hemmingway Suite after the wedding and it was perfect. I could live there! We were pretty disappointed with the size of our King rooms though, (in the "B" section) so we ended up upgrading to a Suite ("E" section) for the last 2 nights and it was only $30 more. We were able to look at a lot of different rooms and they were all a little different. The queen rooms were really big even though they only had queen beds. The king rooms were so small, we barely had room to walk around the bed, yet they were more expensive, didn't really make sense. So, if you don't like the room you end up with, it doesn't hurt to ask to change rooms. Some people in the F and H sections complained about the roosters, but we hardly heard them at all. This is a great location close enough to walk to Duvall St, but far enough away so it's quiet and relaxing. Parking was a little tricky, but it wasn't horrible like some people have said. I was very happy with Light House Court and plan on staying there for our anniversary trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rockindalake
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rates, great location, clean accommodations, friendly staff. A nice quiet place to come back to at the end of a Key West day. We loved it and will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect escape :)”
Reviews.Author: keylargogirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lighthouse Court with two of my friends, it was so amazing. This hotel has the perfect location, perfect walking distance to Duval Street. The staff is great and the hotel has a very welcoming atmosphere. The pool is great and you can sit by the pool and drink at the hotel bar :) perfect for a getaway to paradise!

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want out of Key West?!?”
Reviews.Author: VBKrista
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lighthouse Court & had the best experience! Was in walking distance to Duval Street & right across from the Inn was Hemingway's House, what more could you want out of Key West?!? Our continental breakfast was by the pool which is peacefully surrounded by palm trees. Looking forward to enjoying the other Historic Inns very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool vibe - across from Hemmingways & under the Lighthouse”
Reviews.Author: BirthdayInBelize
Reviews.Content: Staff are most accomodating and friendly. Location is hard to beat - quiet privacy tucked under the palms around a quaint deck/pool area. Just down the alley is Blue Heaven restaurant... Over one block on Duval is La Croissant - good breakfast... it's a short walk to the little store... one block off Duval on peaceful Whitehead St. It's only a quick ten minute walk to Mallory Square. The Hemmingway suite is fantastic with loft bedroom & full kitchen!!! Book it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Lighthouse Court is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: marlie53
Reviews.Content: I have visited Key West numerous times since 1997 and this is the first time I have stayed at Lighthouse Court. The accommodations were perfect. Everything was clean and ready at time of check in. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back--soon, I hope!”
Reviews.Author: Starfish09
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this great B&B. The rooms were exceptional, the staff helpful and friendly, the grounds were beautiful. Had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!~!!”
Reviews.Author: LLplusJW
Reviews.Content: Great location. Limited parking, but was a holiday weekend,found a spot 1 block away. Nice pool and bar. Plenty of seating outside and around the pool for breakfast. Nice room with good size bath. Enjoyed sitting on the porch in late evening after meeting people poolside. Wwill definitly sty here again. Have told our friends to stay here too.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to the action but far enough away to feel relaxed.”
Reviews.Author: twindesmo
Reviews.Content: Located directly across from the Hemingway House the Lighthouse Court made me feel like I was part of Ernest's extended family. With private decks shaded with large palms and a modest sized pool the hotel was accomodating and comfortable. Continental breakfast was served outside on nice mornings, albeit of marginal quality, and inside the pool room on not so nice mornings. Enjoy the view of Hemingway's cats and walk a block to Duval St. It's all right there with ease of access from the Lighthouse Court.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and close to all of Old Townâ€™s activities”
Reviews.Author: XCHIEF
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Light House Court and My family and friends intend to return again. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. It would be hard to find more centrally located lodging for all of Old Towns activities that is still quiet enough to allow you nights sleep. The rooms have real Key West charm with no two being the same. In short if you like Key West you will love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Key West Hotel”
Reviews.Author: islandgirlS_c_
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Lighthouse Court Hotel this past weekend. Very nice place across from Hemmingway House. Walking distance to everything you would want to do in town! On Whitehead Street which is 1 block off Duval. Courtyard area is beautiful. Staff very friendly and helpful. Pool bar a little expensive.Better off bringing your own mixers to drink ! Lighthouse is on property next door. Quiet at night. Very nice stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “charming”
Reviews.Author: loribabes
Reviews.Content: Very nice quaint place to stay. Location is right in front of Ernest Hemingway house. Room is spacious. Staff are friendly. The have free muffin and bagels for breakfast, which is not bad at all. The place is just overall darling. We love the place, will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Quirky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: poodsuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and it was really a gorgeous hotel! We had originally booked into the sister hotel, Albury Court, but we complained and they moved us here and I'm so pleased they did. Due to the Albury being so awful we weren't sure what to expect from this hotel but we were so pleasantly surprised! The hotel is on a corner and just one block over from Duval St. Its really rustic and charming with the rooms kinda dotted all over the place but all centered around the pool. The floor of the hotel is all decking which looks really nice and authentic. Our room was really big and spacious and the air con was good. Perfect location for exploring Key West. Breakfast was included in the price and it was really nice as well, there's bagels and pastries and coffee etc. Would happily stay here again! P.S. If you like Nacho's go to Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville! The plate fed 4 of us and that's 2 teenage boys as well!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Awesome! Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Fresh144
Reviews.Content: if you're spending a few days in Key West the Light House Court is perfect!. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. There is a great little pool and a bar that you can easily spend a hot key west day in or a quiet night. The Light House is close to everything and right in front of the Ernest Hemmingway Home! and if you're not sure where to go or what to do just stop by the front desk and you'll get plenty of suggestions and recommendations. The Suite I stayed in was clean, quiet and comfortable and even had a little patio which was great after a long night out on the town. In the morning there is complimentary continental bkfast by the pool...great way to start the day! if you want to go out for breakfast though, I recommend the "Croissant's de France" which is right around the corner on Duval Street. Parking was not difficult at all, and there was plenty available. I had such a great time and will be back for sure!! My new Key West spot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grass-Geoffrion Wedding in Key West”
Reviews.Author: ArmyWifeGeoffrion
Reviews.Content: Dear Lighthouse Court Staff, Wow...!!! What a great experience we had having our wedding at Lighthouse Court! Your staff was fantastic! Your property manager, Andy Olday is a gem! He was so wonderful to us and so accommodating with every last minute request I made (which was several each day) and he made our stay and wedding event a total success! The space in the back of the property was the perfect backdrop. The property itself was so beautiful and our pictures turned out spectacular! All of our guests commented on what a great location it was and though those nasty, menacing clouds threatened to rain on our parade, Andy and the catering staff had a "plan b" and set us up in spite of mother nature! In the end, there was no rain, but they had our backs the whole time! We loved it completely and the service was TOP SHELF! Very well done! Many thanks to everyone who helped our wedding be a great reunion in an environment that seemed like we all lived on the same block for a long weekend! Even the guests who weren't invited sat outside waiting for us to come out and cheered us on for the ceremony! It was fantastic and we WILL be back next July. Many thanks for a job Super well done! Regards, Mr. and Mrs. Robert Geoffrion! HOOAH!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Keyscritter93
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Lighthouse many times and really like it. It is very Key West and is in a great location, close to all you might need to do or see. Rooms are very clean and plenty of space for the most part. Up grade if you can, it's worth the extra $$. I live about 100mls away and will return as soon as I can. There is limited parking, but I have never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money...”
Reviews.Author: happytraveling4
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited the lighthouse court in June. It wasn't too busy, there were just enough people around to feel cozy without it being overcrowded. The southermost point , Higgs Beach, Mallory square are just a short bike ride away. Being a block from Duval, the location was good because it was close to all of the activity. As long as you stay on the Duval street side of the inn you are fine, but if there was an "inner-city" in Key West, you are not far from it. We had a King suite which was a decent size. (We peeked in the queen size rooms and do not recomend them.) The king rooms come with a mini-fridge which was a plus! The bed was entirely too firm for us but what hotel bed isn't? The pool was nice and clean but a little on the small side. The hotel staff was friendly and accomodating and even gave us a later check out. Overall, we had a very good stay and would recomend this hotel because you can get a great deal for a quite stay still close to all of the festivities Key West has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & shabby shiek...in danger of being just shabby very soon.”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdvisorySC
Reviews.Content: There's a charm about this historical hotel, if you can see past its deterioration. I first stayed there four years ago and couldn't wait to go back. Upon my visit this past May, it seems that the hotel is not being kept up, especially given its room rates. The sun decks are rotting, old rattling window unit airconditioners are mounted into the walls, the furniture and mattresses are worn, the rooms are in need of serious renovation. The breakfast that they offer, once wonderful, now leaves a lot to be desired. The pool bar is hardly open and they've done away with their gym. Parking is hard to find, though this is nothing new and once could be overlooked when all else was well at this establishment. Their pool sound system once softly played steel drum music and sounds of the islands, now only plays rap and hard rock. I checked in and turned on my air conditioner as low as it would go. An hour later, I reported to the main office that it was not working and that I was going out for the day. Upon coming back, the front deskman let me know it had been fixed. However, such was not the case. There are more charming and better kept hotels to stay at in Key West. Sadly Lighthouse Court once was one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Lighthouse Court- Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnh156832
Reviews.Content: Stayed three days at The Lighthouse Court in Key West and absolutely loved it. We paid the extra money for one of the "Superior Queen" rooms with a Queen size bed and private balcony. The room was spotlessly cleaned, spacious and well furnished. We were also impressed by the staff, especially Paul at the front desk upon our arrival. He made us feel right at home and really set the mood for our entire stay. The grounds well kept but be aware the management do not recommend bare feet on the wooden decks. The pool are offers plenty of space to lounge and has a small bar serving some sandwiches for lunch. Once inside the hotel gates it does not feel like you are only one block for the hustle of Duval Street. On the negative side, parking can be a challenge in the are and the hotel can only offer parking for about 10 cars. Housekeeping id a great job in our room, but frequently did come until after noon. Will recommend this hotel and will defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lighthouse Dump”
Reviews.Author: MichelinReviewer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Lighthouse Court for over twenty years. Many years ago the property was well kept, but that is not true today. Buildings and decks have rotted wood, old window air conditioners rattle and don't work very well, beds are pillows are not to standards based upon room charges, and the morning pool side continental breakfast consists basically of a choice of toast, muffin, juice and coffee...maybe an apple while the supply lasts. Basically this "historical inn" has seen its best days and the only thing going for it today is it close proximity to Duval Street and the Hemingway House across the street. Parking is limited or non-existent, management is slow to respond to problems, towels and sheets are ragged and torn, wooden decks have rotted with holes, duck tape covers holes in the roofs of many buidings, and what was once the gym is now just a room with wall mirrors. There are much better values available today in Key West...look around before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you're looking for - OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: sunnyskiesabove
Reviews.Content: I agree with the review from "Sunseeker14". This place was OK. We had no major complaints about the accommodations overall, but it maybe was missing some of the little things that you'd hope to have in your room. For example, my mother (who was staying with me complained of not having room to put any of her toiletries in the bathroom. And, she wanted a hook or something on the back of the door to hang a towel or her clothes. The bathrooms are small, but they could add some shelving and some hooks, etc. to make them a little nicer. Also, our safe was attached to the floor in the corner of the room. This was really very inconvenient. My mom is 65 years old and was unable to actually see or get to the keypad to put anything in the safe. I'm 35 and while I could get in and out of the safe, it was a major hassle to do so. They need to move the safe onto a table (and bolt it into the wall) or into a shelf in the closet or something rather than on the floor. The best part about the hotel is the location. It's very close to Duvall St. My mom found it to be a challenging walk to Mallory Square. (however, I found it to be fine.) So, it depends on how much walking you want to do. The bed was comfortable. The air conditioning worked well but was loud. I actually thought that was probably a good thing because the roosters would have woken us up otherwise. However, if you get cold easily, this may be a problem for you. The courtyard is very pleasant here and the breakfast was a nice touch. (bagels, muffins, toast, coffee, juice and yogurt) Don't stay here, though, if you are choosing it for it's pool. The pool itself is tiny. You'd only want to use it to dip into for a moment if you get too hot. Also, the pool does not get much sun. It is very shady there. There is a sun deck above the pool which would get a little more sun, but there aren't many chairs up there. And, you have to watch out for splinters. (My brother managed to get a couple while walking around barefoot up there.) As others have said, a problem for this hotel is the parking. There are 10 (or less) spots, including ones where you block in other cars (and give your keys to the front desk). My star rating is not based on the following, but I do want to share an experience we had at this hotel: We actually felt so lucky to have found a spot in the hotel parking lot but later regretted parking there. (The other option was on-street parking (if you could actually find a spot, which seemed unlikely) or a $20 a day paid lot nearby.) The reason we regretted parking there was because when we got back from a long day of going to my brother's wedding and then to a sunset sail and then out to Duvall St., we returned to find a note from hotel management saying that a limb had fallen from a "neighbor's" tree and hit our car. They provided a name and the phone number for the Key West police dept for us to call if we wished to report it. (which we did) Our car had a noticable dent in the back of the roof just above the back windshield in addition to numerous scratches. My brother's car (which had been parked in front of ours) also sustained damage. I realize that some people will debate this with me, but if I park in the TINY lot that is the official parking lot for the hotel, I would think that they would take some responsibility for this. They did not and specifically refused when I asked about it. They said that they would have if it had been their tree, but that there was nothing they could do since the tree belonged to the neighbor. I beg to differ. There was SOMETHING that they could have done even if they refused to pay for at least part of the damage, such as providing one of the 6 nights that my brother and I paid for there for free or at a discounted rate - - - something that could have sought to make up for the hassle and expense that this damage was bound to cause. This was a LARGE limb - - at least 10 inches in diameter that obviously was hanging over the Lighthouse Court hotel parking lot. I was very disappointed that the management did nothing to try to compensate us for the damage to our vehicle. (The neighbor who owned the tree also refused to do anything. So, if I would like any compensation, I would have to take them to court (in Key West obviously), which I'm sure both the hotel and the neighbor realize is unlikely since I live out of state.) Like I said, there are people who will agree with the hotel management --- that because they were not "legally" responsible that there was nothing that they should have done. I expect greater service from the hotels that I choose to stay in. That is obviously my own personal view. 4 out of the 6 people in our group at breakfast the next morning agreed with my view, but I realize that it is not a clear cut issue. Just thought that I should post it since there will be those out there who will agree that they will want to stay in a place where they can feel secure that management will protect their interests and go out of their way to ensure a pleasant, stress-free stay. Otherwise, this hotel is an adequate place to stay. However, if I were to go back, I'd probably stay where my cousins did at Southernmost on the Beach where they said there was plenty of parking, a nice pool with poolside service and where they are right on the beach. Again, though, it just depends on what you're looking for and what's most important to you...

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker14
Reviews.Content: We had some mixed feelings about our stay at the Lighthouse Court, it wasn't terrible but we probably wouldn't stay there again. We arrived mid afternoon, however the room wasn't ready so headed to Duval Street for lunch after being extremely lucky and managing to bag a parking spot right outside the hotel, where the car then stayed for the duration of the trip! We returned to find that we had been upgraded to a slightly larger room, however one of the biggest issues was that the room was incredibly dark even in the middle of the day, we couldn't always have curtains open due to privacy as we were on the ground floor and behind reception meaning that most guests had to walk past our window. The room was large however and bed very comfortable, albeit we were forever bashed our legs on the wooden bed frame (as did the maintenance guy who came to fix our safe!) Housekeeping wasn't as good as it could have been with something being missed most days, such as bins not being emptied or hand towels not being replaced. The bathroom could have also done with some updating and some extra shelving for toiletries. The outside space of the hotel was pleasant with lots of porches and trees with a great deck on the upper floor for sunbathing and a cute little pool. They do state that you aren't supposed to take your own drinks to the pool but every time I went to the bar there was no-one serving so we did end up taking our own. The breakfast was adequate with orange juice, tea & coffee, pastries and yogurt and the ever present roosters who strutted around looking for crumbs (which we didn't mind at all!) We really liked the location, although for some it might be a bit of a walk to Mallory Square, it was perfect for us. Right across the road from the Hemingway house and running parallel to Duval Street meant that we were close enough to all the main attractions but without any of the noise. Overall I think there are probably better value for money options in Key West, although an expensive place to stay in general. While none of the issues really justified complaints, the management need to give more attention to detail here and spend a bit of money on updating some of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: KB620
Reviews.Content: Stayed here alone while visiting a family member. Decent place for the money. Clean, nice pool area. Very Close to Duval and a short walk to the Southernmost point. Literally right across the street from Hemingway house. Not a great breakfast selection, just some bagels, english muffins, mini muffins, and clementines for fruit. If you want to spend some time at the beach I would recommend paying a bit more to stay at one of the oceanside resorts just for a night or two. They have private beaches for guests that are much better than the public beaches.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: yomanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. The hotel was nice and room was clean. Pool area was nice too. They served the breakfast by the pool. Only negative thing was the roosters yelling all night long, but I think that is a problem anywhere you go in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place”
Reviews.Author: CJ_214
Reviews.Content: Cute little place very close to Duval St and a short walk away from Mallory Square to watch amazing sunsets!! Walked or rode a bike EVERYWHERE which really really helped. Parking is limited but luckily we did not have a problem, and once we parked, we did not move the car once. Went for a romantic getaway, had a SMALL room, was perfect for 2 of us though, but certainly more expensive than I would have expected for the size of the room. I guess you pay for the location, and the location is great :)

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Humanfactor
Reviews.Content: The good: Excellent location... right across the street from the Ernest Hemingway House. The staff was very helpful. Vicky was extremely helpful and proactive when I had a "housekeeping" issue in my room in the late evening. The place has a nice atmosphere and is probably reasonably priced for the area. I paid $149 per night, though I would say I felt I over paid a bit. The not so good: I don't think their house keeping staff has the attention to detail as I found the upkeep of my room to not always be so good. It would be nice if the rooms had a little coffee maker, etc... (I was in room A1). Their wake up call didn't work!!! Lucky I had an alarm on my watch set.

Reviews.Title: “Decent mid-range hotel, but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: frackit
Reviews.Content: We rented two rooms over Thanksgiving, one deluxe and one suite. There was little difference in size or furnishings between the two rooms...in fact we thought the deluxe was a bit nicer. Both felt damp all the time. The front desk staff was a bit rude at check-in. Everything worked fine, but there were some cleanliness issues. The worst part was the noise - next year we will vacation in Time Square for some peace and quiet. The neighborhood roosters started at about 11:30pm each night and continued all night until 7am. Then they would come collect the trash and recycling in the middle of the night every night and the truck felt like it was backing into our hotel room...literally we would feel it bump the building while beep-beeping at 3am, backing up and pulling forward 20 times. Lastly, the laundry room was below us and they would start doing laundry early in the morning..with the laundry door open...and the squeekiest laundry machine I every heard...oil that thing! Other than that, it was reasonably comfortable and in a great location across from the Hemingway house. We will not stay here again, as there are many other wonderful choices in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: littlebudget_usd
Reviews.Content: It's incredible how central the hotel is located but how quiet it is! Right in front of Mr. Hemingway house, 20 mins beautiful walk to the beach or 6 mins by bike! We got a superior room wich was good value for money quite big and very good housekeeping. The pool is not big but stunning enough to relax and sip a cocktail at their bar. The Breakfast consists of bagels, muffins, bread, butter, jam to eat and a choice of Earl Grey Tea, Coffee, Decaff Coffee. Very basic but gorgeous patio to enjoy it by the pool. I would consider staying there again, definately made a very good choice among the many options of accommodation in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lighthouse”
Reviews.Author: TwistedSail
Reviews.Content: I really liked this little hotel. I had a TINY room, but big enough for two. People were really nice. There was a young woman working the desk, whose name I can't remember even though I wrote it down somewhere, who was just great. The room was spotless, the pool lovely and the location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Lighthouse Court!”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveler_2003
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed a 2-day stay at the Lighthouse Court and loved everything about it. The location was great - directly across the street from the Hemmingway Home and was within walking distance to other popular sights, restaurants, shops and the pier. Parking was probably the only challenge as it was quite limited. Other than that, the staff was great, breakfast was good and the rooms were cozy and nicely decorated. We'd definitely go there again and in the meantime will recommend it anyone who plans to visit Key West, FL. Photo Slideshow http://www.flickr.com/photos/joelle_108/sets/72157607294847830/

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: IndyBois
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had our commitment ceremony in KW in June 2008, We started working with Denise at The Lighthouse Court early on and she was the best. It is hard to plan a trip for 30 people, thousands of miles away but Denise made it so easy for us. When we arrived she went out of her way to accomendate us. They are in the process of remodeling the rooms and all the rooms either remodeled or not were great, our whole party of 30 had a great time at the Lighthouse Court. We will stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Loved It! Will return!!!”
Reviews.Author: heatherbrodnicki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three day stay at the Lighthouse Court. We loved everything about it....super clean, wonderful staff, and great location!! We hung out by the pool in the morning, strolled Duval, and enjoyed the wonderful weather. Every morning we enjoyed coffee, orange juice , bagels, toast, yogart, danishes, and muffins by the pool. This hotel is located right across the street from the Hemingway House ( which is very cool)! All in all, we will be returning to the Lighthouse Court next summer. It is our new fav in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: meliss8900
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel just a week ago and while it was nice to stay just one block away from the madness for some privacy. The parking is mostly street parking which is very hard to find so going places in the car was ruled out. The hotel staff was not overly friendly and the pool bar was not that great, being only only 3 days a week for limited hours. The housekeepers did not clean the room until after 3 or 4 p.m. everyday which was pretty annoying after being out all day and coming back to no clean towels. All in all I stayed at worse I proably will not go back however but for the price its not terriable

Reviews.Title: “Not All Wonderful at Lighthouse Court”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne202
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lighthouse Court for three nights. I agree with other guests that the Lighthouse Court's location in relation to the quiet end of Duval Street was great, but repeated walks to Mallory Square were a little too much for me (some mobility issues plus temperature and humidity). My main gripe was the fact that in our room (5C) the glass door to the shower stall was off its damaged track, and even after maintenance "fixed" it, was always in danger of falling off again. Also, the 14" opening into the shower required going in sideways, very carefully, to avoid damaging vulnerable body parts. A big person is definitely not going to fit. A shower update is WAY overdue, and meanwhile there should be a serious price break for guests who end up in 5C. The included breakfast was so-so, typical continental offerings (bagels, juice, coffee, etc.), and the setting was mediocre as well--a basically bare concrete patio next to the pool, with little landscaping. Overall, some good points, a few problems. Bottom line: I'd stay there again, but first I'd shop around for a B&B closer to Mallory Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Lighthouse Court”
Reviews.Author: jimDavis
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance of all the main Key West attractions, this B & B has clean, comfortable rooms. We stayed for 3 nights the first week of January. Parking is a bit of a challange, as it is in most of the old town area. The staff were all very helpful, as first time Key West visitors they gave us some welcomed recommendations on things to see and do. This place also has a heated pool, a poolside bar ( best Pina Colada I ever had) and a good but limited lunch menu. Breakfast is served poolside each morning which is pretty basic but gave us a great start to the day. Nice place, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best...”
Reviews.Author: u12mjw
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, no doubt. It's connected to the lighthouse which is a good attraction and is across the road from the Hemmingway House which means it's easy to get too but also that troops of tourists arrive outside your room, early and stay all day! As for the hotel. It's clearly overpriced and the rooms are very small. Queens are really doubles. You can tell that at one point in time this was a great place but reinvestment in the asset has been poor. Glass tiles in the bathrooms are loose and the grout work needs redone. The external property is kept well and the grounds people do a great job. I think this would be a great hotel if rooms were $120 but not at $250+. Saying that it is expensive to stay in Key West in general and there are clearly places much worse. So if Michael Porter came for a visit he would say they had sussed the power of competition and priced correctly! In summary, I would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice pool and lounge area but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: boeseknecht
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Christmas at the Lighthouse court. We loved the pool and lounge are (although the barkeeper at the pool bar could use some mixing lessons.) The location one block from Duval Street is also very convenient to reach basically every place of interest. The rooms are small but ok and clean. Most of them are different so it's worth checking out which one you like best. Overall it's a very nice place but definitely overpriced for the room size and service quality you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mulva8
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I got a great deal on a room at the Lighthouse Court the week before Christmas. The property is really cute, the staff is very friendly and you can't beat the location. Couple of hints - the superior queen rooms all seem to face the street and during busy seasons I am sure could be a bit noisy. These rooms also seem to get a lot of light from the street lights so the room was never completely dark. I would upgrade to the King rooms since those all seem to face the pool. The Lighthouse Court is right across the street from the Hemingway House and one block off Duval. It's about 8-10 blocks from Mallory Square (a must for sunsets) and about 4 blocks from the Southern Most Point marker. Excellent location for getting around! According to a travel book I read this property use to be the place to stay for gay men, but it is not like that any more. It is geared to couples and all rooms (I think) are double capacity only. There are also single, budget room options. Hint for Key West - rent bikes! Parking is limited so once you park your car (leagally) leave it and get around on bikes. There are dozens of places to rent bikes and there are bike racks everywhere you go to secure your bike.

Reviews.Title: “great service!!”
Reviews.Author: bangbros
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff should be working at a 5star Resort they were AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The best service I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Paradise”
Reviews.Author: GregnCourt
Reviews.Content: My friend recommended the Key Lime Inn a sister to the Lighthouse Inn, we decided on the Lighthouse Inn due to the pool bar!! We were very satisfied of the Inn...friendly, clean, close to everything. I would definetly go back in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Loved It! Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: KathyLovesTheKeys
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome! My husband and I stayed for two nights in September 2007. We have been coming down to the Keys at least once a year for the past 6 years. This was THE BEST place to stay. They had a very nice staff. Clean rooms. Good breakfast. Close to everything (maybe a 1/2 mile from everything). Lighthouse practically right next to you. Very quaint and relaxing. Pool was a little small. Parking here is tough though. You pretty much have to stay parked at their hotel the whole time without leaving. If you do leave, you are most likely going to lose your parking space for the remainder of your stay. They tell you that there are pay lots down the road. I thought they really should have enough parking to accomodate all of their customers... But they don't. We just stayed parked there all weekend, and walked everywhere we wanted to go. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here. Very Peaceful place to stay and the hotel rates were pretty reasonable. -Kathy

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax, but stay close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: gaparrothead
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after reading some "old" travel books, but man was I blown away. My girlfriend and I stayed for a week at the Light House and loved every single day. It was located only a few minutes from anywhere that you would want to go on Key West. The rooms were always clean. While the rest of the property was super charming. There was plenty of bike storage so we would ride all over the island then come back for an afternoon nap. It's located off touristy Duval on historic Whitehead. I would recommend the property for anyone. The Hemmingway house is across the street & the historic light house is next door. We got engaged there and will visit the Light House Court again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: happysmile165
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights here on our honeymoon. We were treated wonderfully by the folks at the front desk and were given an upgraded room at no extra charge. I am glad we got the upgrade as the room was still a little small but, it's key west, so who cares!! The atmosphere was quiet and very laid back. We had a fabulous time! The breakfast was just ok, but enough to get the day rolling. Very close to all the action and yet restful.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful getaway, in the center of all the action”
Reviews.Author: steph42
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. Location is wonderful just steps away from Duval Street but very quiet and peaceful. Staff was friendly but they are also out of the way so you feel like it's you own little home. Super clean, grounds are beautiful, nice gym,felt safe. I can see myself staying here again, it's just my style. Parking wasn' t a big deal, we got a space right out front and didn't move it for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AnInveterateTraveler
Reviews.Content: The stay was excellent! My girlfriend was visiting the keys for the first time and I was looking for a romantic place to spend the night, and this fit the bill perfectly. I called ahead since we were arriving late at night, and the person at the desk was EXTREMELY helpful and friendly. She arranged to have everything waiting for us when we came, and even called around to book a snorkeling trip the next day. When we got there the location was perfect (1 block from Duval Street) and we were able to find parking right in front of the hotel. They had a beautiful garden you walk through to get to the room (right next to the pool). It was quiet and very nice. The room was extremely spacious, but it was cozy and the bed was large. The next morning we were able to walk to the harbor to get on our boat. Very satisfied with our stay. Maybe we just got lucky (Thursday night so not a lot of people/guests and plenty of parking), but we were quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JambalayaJon
Reviews.Content: My now-fiance and I decided to go to Key West for vacation in April.
