I was almost hesitant to book with lighthouse court because of some of the bad reviews--do not let them affect your decision!! Once we arrived in Key West, we loved everything about it. And the Lighthouse Court made it even better. it is a nice cozy place to stay, our room was simple but had everything we needed. The pool was small, but very clean; the entire pool area is very relaxing. there is a poolside bar and a small workout room. The breakfast provided every morning is very good, and all of the staff are very friendly and helpful. The court is across the street from Ernest Hemingway's house, and directly beside the lighthouse! Overall, we didn't really find anything negative about this place, and we're already planning to go back and stay at the Lighthouse Court! A word of advice, though--park your car and rent a scooter! everywhere in key west is close by, and can be walked to. Parking is hard to come by for cars, though, so park your car and forget about it for your whole stay!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay there but had a drink there!”
Reviews.Author: katweber01
Reviews.Content: We looked into staying here, but there wasn't any vacancy. However after touring the Hemingway House on a nice hot August day, we noticed a sign that read! Open to the public for Drinks! So in we went, there was a bartender making any kinds of drinks you'd like, by the pool. He was very nice! As I enjoyed my drink, I realized how nice it was to have a small bar at your inn, because theres nothing you'd rather do on a hot day than swim and have a cocktail! The pool was clean, there was a huge excersise room, and the bathroom that I used was clean. From what I saw this was a nice place! Located across the street from the Hemingway House, and a block over from Duval! Good location, drinks, pool and weight room! Hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: “I was sceptical but...”
Reviews.Author: nikkoiscrazy
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get away for a weekend with my fiancee' so we booked a room here based mostly on the hotels price and proximity to Duval Street. After booking the room online I decided to read the reviews. I was a bit disappointed to learn after booking the room that I was going to have to share a bathroom with 3 other rooms so I called the hotel to cancel my reservations which they seemed more than willing to do. However, the woman at the front desk offered us a free upgrade to a room with its own bathroom and shower which my fiancee' and myself accepted. The location was great (1 street away from Duval Street) although the neighborhood seemed a little seedy. The hotel has only 7 parking spots so chances are you'll most likely need to park on the street, which we didn't think was much of a big deal. We were given room J2, the only stand alone cottage, we were told, in Lighthouse Court. It was very small but we loved it and found it charming, it was a refreshing change from the usual generic luxury hotels that we are used to (check out the pictures.) The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. Not only would we stay here again, but I told my cousin how pleasant our experience here was and she is going with her boyfriend this weekend and staying in the same room that we stayed in. They also set up a nice continental breakfast each morning, coffee, oj, bagels, and english muffins. they have a small gym on the premise as well. If you are a happy & content person, you will love Lighthouse Court. If you are a hotel critic, you will probably find a few things to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Found a Jewel”
Reviews.Author: cruzinqueen
Reviews.Content: Wanted to try something different, been at most of the major hotels, and I was pleased to discover Lighthouse Court Inn. It was a fair price excellent location, parking was tricky, but the front desk was helpful with everything. From rescheduling flights, to calling taxis when need be. I would stay at this location again, and would try other B & B's recommended here, thank you Steve for all your input. It was a relaxed atmosphere, and a nice change from fancy hotels. The grounds are lovely and kept clean, lots of relaxing corners for converstion or whatever. This is about my 20th trip to Key West in 10 years, another wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Normally better”
Reviews.Author: CaptnBob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this property on 2 prior occasions and have been very happy with everything. Great location, nice and clean rooms, great pool. Parking is a problem but not unique to Lighthouse Court, its tough all over the island. On this stay we were not happy with our room (#J2). While it was very clean and the air conditioning was excellent, the size of the room was absurd. It measured 7 feet 8 inches by 11 feet 8 inches, barely big enough for the bed (double, not queen as advertised). The car we drove to Key West was bigger than the room that we stayed in for 5 days. In the event we stay there again, I will certainly make sure they tell me what room I'm getting before any money changes hands.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Lighthouse”
Reviews.Author: enjoylife07
Reviews.Content: We started our vacation in Key West and booked the Lighthouse Court just by looking at the pics online. When we got there the parking was a little tricky but we found a spot right outside our room. The hotel had very nice accomodations. The bar near the pool was quaint and everyone of the staff were very pleasant. The hotel is close to everything and you can rent bikes right around the corner and bike everywhere. You see a lot more when you do that. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone and plan on going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Lighthouse Court”
Reviews.Author: friar21
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on 6/3. Wife and I were very pleased with the facility and customer service. Even got a parking space at the rear "lot." Nice pool and reasonable room. Well situated for getting to action on Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Not to shabby”
Reviews.Author: sgleitz
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews here, I was scared when we pulled up. We arrived early and found that our room was not quite ready. Not a problem for us since we had been in the car for a couple of hours. We showed back at 3p and our room was ready. We went upstairs and checked things out, and we were pleasantly surprised. We were in the king size room, C3, and yes it was smaller than the average hotel room we typically stay in, but it is a historic inn. The area surrounding the hotel does leave much to be desired, but as we came to find, that is the "charm" associated with Key West. Some areas are brand new or newly rennovated while other areas are not. This difference didn't seem to be centered in one area or the other, that is how it all seemed to be, one house is really nice, the one next door, not so much. No problems to report here though. The staff was pleasant and the chickens that seem to live there made us laugh more than anything. The breakfast was simple, yes, but more than many hotels offer. They also have free wifi in the pool area which was unexpected. The parking issue that is mentioned frequently, didn't really phase us. We found an open spot on the street and stayed there for 7 nights we were there. The gym is a weight room, no cardio, that is used by the public that work with a particular group of trainers. This causes the room to be quite cramped when trying to get a morning workout in. But the afternoons seem to see lighter traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed an Economy Room”
Reviews.Author: BarefootBert
Reviews.Content: If not for the kids that backed up the bathroom on the last day, this was my best stay in 16 years. BFB

Reviews.Title: “No Parking!!”
Reviews.Author: jmacMaritimer
Reviews.Content: Trying to find somewhere to park was an hour-long NIGHTMARE! The website didn't adequately explain the parking situation in Key West, nor did it mention that there are only about six parking spaces for 40 rooms at the Court. The staff were completely unhelpful and unsympathetic about our parking plight, which really left a bad taste in my mouth. To top it all off, the water pressure in the shower was terribly low. On the positive side, the Court is quite a lovely place, in a great location, right next to the Key West lighthouse, and across the street from the Hemingway house. I can handle bad water pressure and rude staff, but I would never stay there again after what we went through trying to find somewhere to park.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, but snotty staff, no water pressure and no parking.”
Reviews.Author: cmorrisse
Reviews.Content: What an amazing looking place. Rooms and courtyard were great. However, there was no water pressure in the shower, not LOW water pressure, NO water pressure. The staff was indifferent bordering on snotty to the fact that there was no parking available and finally the heated pool was not. Not a huge deal compared to the previous issues. If the management would get their act together and take care of the easily-fixable problems, and maybe get some happier employees, this place would be a home run, otherwise, don't waste your money and time staying at the Lighthouse Court.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Floridiangirl2903
Reviews.Content: The Lighthouse Court was a great place to stay in Key West. They are located walking distance to Duval St but far enough away to be peaceful. The room had everything we needed, a large bathroom, and a front porch. Our room was a queen superior which meant we had a bathroom inside our room. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only downside was the roosters. Key West has many chickens that were originally bred to cockfight still roaming the streets. One rooster near the property was crowing every couple of hours even in the middle of the night. This was not under the control of the hotel and I do not blame them for this in any way. However, I recommend bringing earplugs if you are a light sleeper. One flaw that should be noted is the breakfast. It is a continental breakfast consisting of yogurt and bagels served outside by the pool. I would think that for the price of the room a hot breakfast could be served. I also did not like having to sit near smokers while trying to eat my breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Budget room at Lighthouse Court”
Reviews.Author: aselco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend in Key West. The Lighthouse Court is in a perfect location. One block off mid-Duval, so it is a 10 -15 minute walk to Fort Zachary Taylor Park, Mallory Square, Southernmost Point, and right across the street from the Hemingway House. It is also right near Blue Heaven, one of my favorite restaurants of all time. There is a nice courtyard, with a heated pool, and plenty of chaise lounges for relaxing in the sun. The breakfast was fine - bagels, english muffins, juice, coffee, oranges and coffee. We were able to use the property's free parking and not have to worry about our car the entire weekend. We were on a pretty tight budget, and didn't plan to spend much time at our hotel, so we booked a "budget room" for two nights at $120/ night plus tax and service. The budget part is that it is a shared bath. The bedroom was tiny and basic. We didn't need much more, as all we did was sleep there. However, we felt we were a bit misled by the website which said there are "two bathrooms." There are two rooms with facilities; one with a sink and toilet and one with two showers and two sinks. The showers were fine, but there were eight of us in the budget rooms, and I did find myself in line for the one toilet at 2:15 am. I have stayed in many places with shared baths, but never with eight people for one toilet. That said, the room was fine, and we would stay there again, but spend a little bit more if it would get us a private bath.

Reviews.Title: “fun and friendly”
Reviews.Author: global_10
Reviews.Content: With this being my first visit I wasn't to sure on where to stay when coming to Key West but had lighthouse court recommended by friends. It was a pleasant place with a very relaxing atmosphere. I found the room to my high standard of cleanliness, the bar (limited hours) and heated pool are most delightful; However I would like to have seen a coffee maker in my room. The staff were great and helped with lots of recommendations on places to go during the day and where to eat. I would defiantly pass my information on and hope that people enjoy there stay at lighthouse court as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfied”
Reviews.Author: alibbs22
Reviews.Content: Just returned from five days in Key West where we stayed at Lighthouse Court. Upon check-in the staff was quite rude. They DO NOT go out of their way to make sure your stay is a pleasant one. We booked a superior queen room which was supposed to have a queen bed. The bed was clearly a double, though they insisted it was a queen, and the room was sparsely furnished. The shower was so small you could barely turn around in it. The room also came with continental breakfast which wasn't very impressive either - bagels, toast, coffee. I know the cost of Lighthouse Court is reasonable but they could definitely afford to upgrade their establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, beware of the "efficiency" rooms though”
Reviews.Author: Toejammer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, free breakfast was acceptable and nice little pool area. Great location was in walking distance to everything, and only one block from Duval St, which is perfect for a long night out. The main problem was we were in a efficiency room in the back. The â€œAâ€� block. Which was a European setup, which we did not anticipate or were informed beforehand, ie a shared bathroom and shower between 4 rooms. With 2 people per room sharing 1 bathroom among 8 people was a bit hairy and the only main complaint I had.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location”
Reviews.Author: Odie123
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Lighthouse Court because of it's nice prices and it's location to Duval St. We were planning on walking everywhere and wanted somewhere in the middle of the stretch. What a great little place! We decided to stay frugal with the room and got a standard room (one double bed). The room was clean and nicely decorated. They have nice toiletries and towels. I wouldn't recommend that type of room if you aren't very close to who you're staying with. The bathroom wall didn't go all the way up to the ceiling (the room had nice vaulted ceilings) and the intimate details of bathroom-going were not private. Also, don't plan on taking short showers because the water pressure is very low. The grounds and pool area are gorgeous and the pool was so warm!! The breakfast, while pretty basic, was always fresh and served poolside every morning. We had a great experience there and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Cruzermom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked only 3 days before our last minute trip. Everything in Old Town Key West was booked! We paid $219 a night for a one bedroom/ one bath room. Beautiful pool and grounds. Well kept. Quiet retreat from busy Duval. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Geat place to stay”
Reviews.Author: unilux
Reviews.Content: Even though the room was quite small, they mostly are in Key West it was very clean and well furnished, good aircon a well equiped gym on site and a nice pool. Excellent food at the pool restaurant. The location is about 8 minute walk to Duval Street but far enough to get piece and quiet when its rest time. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. i recomend you stay

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Gnutter
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I booked this hotel on the Internet mainly because we were looking for a cheap place to stay (almost non-existent in Key West). This was the cheapest we could find and it was still between $100 - $150/night. There was a minor problem with the internet booking (through Orbitz) and while that experience wasn't as pleasant, our stay more than made up for it. We had read the reviews, especially about the noise and the chickens and we never really noticed either while we were there. The buildings comprising the hotel are quite quaint, and I do believe they are in the process of further renovations to some rooms. (This may have been completed by now though.) Our room was beside the pool near the gym. My friend liked the gym area, but the a/c wasn't working while he was working out. He liked the idea of working in sauna conditions, so for him, this wasn't a bad thing. Go figure! Loved the hotel location in that it wasn't on the "strip" per se, but close enough to walk to. Lots of places were within walking distance, so we did our share of that, including the southermost marker, which was down the street. Oh yeah, I did see chickens on someone's front yard while walking to the marker. :) Our room was comfortable and clean. Nothing extra special though. If I had one complaint, it would have to be with the parking because the hotel doesn't have parking at all. You take your chances on the street. We lucked out and found a spot on the street on the next block and left the car there the whole time. I think I remember reading that you have unrestricted parking on the week-end.

HotelInfo.Name: Lighthouse Court
HotelInfo.Address: 902 Whitehead Street, Key West, FL 33040
